name: appointment
trans: n. 约会, 约定任命, 委派

sentences.chinese: 就诊必须预约。

sentences.chinese: 其他变动包括任命了一位新的外交部长。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement for a meeting at an agreed time and place, for a particular purpose

name: attendance
trans: n. 出席, 参加, 出席次数出席人数

sentences.chinese: 每场比赛平均有4,000名球迷来观战。

detailed_translations.chinese: 出席；到场；出席人数；考勤

adj. 内阁的；私下的，秘密的

sentences.chinese: 总统选择了忠诚的支持者到他的内阁服务。

sentences.chinese: 每年国情咨文都被内阁和幕僚们作为我们提出新政策思路的一个组织工具，然后我们努力下功夫，让它们以最佳方式呈现在人们面前。

detailed_translations.english: the politicians with important positions in a government who meet to make decisions or advise the leader of the government

name: calendar
trans: vt. 将…列入表中；将…排入日程表

sentences.chinese: 墙的上方曾有一本日历，日期框在大方格里。

sentences.english: The Christian calendar was originally based on the Julian calendar of the Romans.
sentences.chinese: 公历最初是基于罗马的儒略历的。

detailed_translations.english: a set of pages that show the days, weeks, and months of a particular year, that you usually hang on a wall

name: clerk
trans: n. 职员，办事员；店员；书记；记帐员
时态:clerked, clerking, clerks名 词:clerkdom

sentences.english: a clerk in a commercial firm
sentences.chinese: 一家商行的文员

detailed_translations.chinese: 职员，办事员；店员；书记；记账员；<古>牧师，教士
detailed_translations.english: someone who keeps records or accounts in an office

detailed_translations.chinese: 当销售员，当店员；当职员
detailed_translations.english: to work as a clerk

name: directory
trans: n. 人名地址录, (电话)号码簿

sentences.english: I couldn’t find your number in the telephone directory.
sentences.chinese: 我在电话簿上找不到你的电话号码。

sentences.english: a new business directory
sentences.chinese: 新的商业名录

detailed_translations.english: a book or list of names, facts etc, usually arranged in alphabetical order

name: in-tray
trans: n. (办公室使用的)公文格,收文篮

name: monitor
trans: n. 监视器，监听器，监控器，班长
时态:monitored, monitoring, monitors名 词:monitorship

sentences.chinese: 心脏监测仪

to carefully watch and check a situation in order to see how it changes over a period of time

name: out-tray
trans: out tray1 ENTRIES FOUND:out tray (noun)out traynounplural out traysout traynounplural out traysLearner's definition of OUT TRAY[count] British:out-box

name: partition
trans: n. 分开, 分割分割物, 隔墙
时态:partitioned, partitioning, partitions名 词:partitioner

sentences.english: ...new offices divided only by glass partitions.
sentences.chinese: …仅仅用玻璃隔板隔开的新办公室。

detailed_translations.chinese: 划分，分开；[数] 分割；隔墙；隔离物

to divide a country, building, or room into two or more parts

trans: n. 时间表, 日程安排表清单, 明细表

sentences.english: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule (= including a lot of things that must be done in a short time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

name: shift
trans: n. 手段；移动；轮班；变化
时态:shifted, shifting, shifts名 词:shifter

sentences.english: They need to shift from farming to industry, and they need to do so desperately.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要从农业领域转移到工业领域。 他们需要拼命地那么做。

sentences.english: the shift from one type of economic system to another
sentences.chinese: 从一种经济体系向另一种经济体系的转变

a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

name: staff
trans: n. 全体职员；教职员参谋，幕僚

sentences.chinese: 员工们都很棒。

sentences.english: 10 staff were allocated to the task.
sentences.chinese: 10名员工被分派做这项任务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全体职员，员工；工作人员；参谋
detailed_translations.english: the people who work for an organization

name: strike
trans: vi. 罢工；打，打击；敲，敲击；抓；穿透；打动
vt. 罢工；打，击；侵袭；打动；撞击，冲击；到达

sentences.english: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
sentences.chinese: 政府承诺，如消防员罢工，就将调军队来协助。

sentences.english: Sara had the task of preparing the agenda for meetings.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉的任务是准备会议议程。

sentences.english: I was given the task of building a fire.
sentences.chinese: 我分配到生火的任务。

sentences.english: the skills required to carry out these tasks
sentences.chinese: 执行这些任务所需要的技能

sentences.english: He soon realized the scale of the task he had undertaken .
sentences.chinese: 他很快就意识到他所承担任务的艰巨性了。

sentences.english: Our first task is to gather information.
sentences.chinese: 我们的首要任务是收集信息。

sentences.english: Monkeys can be taught to do simple tasks .
sentences.chinese: 猴子能被教会做一些简单的事。

sentences.english: They have the unenviable task of supervising the most dangerous prison in the country.
sentences.chinese: 他们有个令人头疼的工作，就是管理国家最危险的监狱。

sentences.english: Volunteers had the thankless task of distributing campaign leaflets.
sentences.chinese: 志愿者的任务是分发活动传单，吃力不讨好。

name: work
trans: vt.&vi. (使)工作(使)运作, 运转(使)产生效果
n. 工作, 劳动, 作业事业工作成果, 产品著作, 作品工厂功

sentences.english: There isn’t a lot of work at this time of the year.
sentences.chinese: 每年这个时候工作机会都不多。

sentences.english: He’s been out of work (= without a job ) for two years.
sentences.chinese: 他失业有两年了。

sentences.english: More people are in work (= have a job ) than ten years ago.
sentences.chinese: 现在有工作的人比十年前多。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作；[物] 功；产品；操作；职业；行为；事业；工厂；著作；文学、音乐或艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a job or activity that you do regularly, especially in order to earn money

detailed_translations.chinese: 使工作；操作；经营；使缓慢前进
detailed_translations.english: to do the activities and duties that are part of your job

name: assignment
trans: n. 工作, 任务分配, 指派

sentences.chinese: 她去意大利执行一项特殊任务。

sentences.english: a history assignment
sentences.chinese: 历史作业

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is given to someone as part of their job

sentences.english: At 3:30 p.m. a bulletin was released announcing that the president was out of immediate danger.
sentences.chinese: 下午3:30发布了公告，宣布总统暂时脱离了危险。

detailed_translations.english: an official statement that tells people about something important

sentences.english: a pocket calculator
sentences.chinese: 一个袖珍计算器

detailed_translations.english: a small electronic machine that can add, multiply etc

sentences.english: I dread to think what the carbon footprint must be like of moving that coal but we have no choice.
sentences.chinese: 我都不敢想象为了运这些煤产生了多少碳足迹，但我们没有选择。

sentences.chinese: 由于猎杀鲸鱼，鲨鱼和大型鱼类，我们也就减少了碳在这些物种群的储存量。

sentences.english: Across the world, forests and the soil beneath them absorb about a quarter of all carbon emissions.
sentences.chinese: 纵观全球，森林与它们脚下的土壤能吸收大约碳排放总量的四分之一。

name: document
trans: n. 文件，公文；文档；证件

sentences.chinese: 她为西雅图市区的一家法律事务所撰写法律文件。

name: extension
trans: n. 延伸, 扩展增加部分电话分机形容词:extensional

sentences.chinese: 能帮我接316号分机吗？

sentences.chinese: 内部通话系统里传来了飞行员的声音。

sentences.chinese: 喂，接线员吗？请帮我接31号房间。

name: overtime

v. 加班地；在规定（工作）时间之外

sentences.chinese: 六小时的加班

sentences.chinese: 他们正在加班赶工。

sentences.english: He’s been doing a lot of overtime recently.
sentences.chinese: 他近来加班很多。

sentences.english: Many employees work countless hours of unpaid overtime.

name: portfolio

sentences.chinese: 你告诉传达员你正在等待一个来自这个客户的电话，并允许将他们接进来。

sentences.chinese: “订书机”是一种能将一小块金属穿过一沓纸把它们放在一起的小物体。

sentences.chinese: 你在心里对自己说“如果下次乔安娜再嚼口香糖的话，我发誓一定冲过去将订书机甩到她位置上。

sentences.chinese: 迟复为歉，敬请原谅。

sentences.chinese: 这学期他已经迟到三次了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迟延， 迟到的； 缓慢的， 迟钝的

sentences.english: I’m a slow typist.
sentences.chinese: 我打字很慢。

trans: n. 施乐（商标名，美国办公设备制造公司）；影印，静电印刷品
vt. 用静电复印法复印Xerox
n. 复印，影印；复印件；影印本

sentences.english: The rooms are crammed with humming Xerox machines.
sentences.chinese: 那些房间里摆满了嗡嗡作响的施乐复印机。

sentences.english: I should have simply Xeroxed this sheet for you.
sentences.chinese: 我本应该只为你复印这张。

detailed_translations.chinese: 施乐（商标名，美国办公设备制造公司）；影印，静电印刷品
detailed_translations.english: A Xerox is a machine that can make copies of pieces of paper which have writing or other marks on them
If you Xerox a document, you make a copy of it using a Xerox machine

trans: n. 奖金；红利；额外津贴BONUSabbr. Boling Nuclear Superheat Reactor 沸腾式过热核反应堆

sentences.english: Long-term savers qualify for a cash bonus.
sentences.chinese: 长期储户可获现金红利。

sentences.english: Further additions to your pay may take the form of bonus payments.
sentences.chinese: 工资以外的钱可能以奖金的形式发放。

sentences.english: a Christmas bonus

sentences.english: Each worker receives an annual bonus.
sentences.chinese: 每个员工都可获得一笔年度奖金。

sentences.english: a £20,000 bonus
sentences.chinese: 一笔2万英镑的奖金

detailed_translations.english: money added to someone’s wages, especially as a reward for good work

name: capability

sentences.english: I can speak French, but simultaneous translation is beyond my capabilities (= too difficult ).
sentences.chinese: 我能讲法语，但是同声传译我做不了。

name: collaboration

sentences.chinese: 该公司正与海洋工程学院合建这座中心。

sentences.chinese: 他们退到另一房间秘密磋商。

sentences.english: This is a critical question that we must answer together through consultation and coordination.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个我们必须通过磋商和协调共同回答的关键问题。

sentences.english: Languages are an essential part of the school curriculum.
sentences.chinese: 语言是学校课程中必不可少的部分。

sentences.english: curriculum planning

detailed_translations.english: the subjects that are taught by a school, college etc, or the things that are studied in a particular subject

name: eligible
trans: adj. 有资格当选的, 有条件被选中的合适的, 适当的名 词:eligibility

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

name: executive
trans: n. 主管，高级行政人员，执行官行政部门
adj. 执行的，行政的；有行政能力的

sentences.english: a commission with executive powers
sentences.chinese: 有执行权的委员会

detailed_translations.english: relating to the job of managing a business or organization and making decisions
a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

sentences.english: low-income families
sentences.chinese: 低收入家庭

detailed_translations.english: the money that you earn from your work or that you receive from investments, the government etc

name: lay

v. 躺；平放；存在，在于（lie 的过去式形式）
adj.外行的，非专业的；（在教会等组织中）兼职的，客串的

sentences.chinese: 他们在这么多人丧生的地方放了一个花圈。

sentences.english: Lay the material flat on the table.
sentences.chinese: 把布料平铺在桌上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 躺下；产卵；搁放；放置；铺放；涂，敷
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something down carefully into a flat position

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的；外行的；没有经验的
detailed_translations.english: not trained or not knowing much about a particular profession or subject

sentences.chinese: 如果你们当中任何一个人成了企业家，这也是我希望你们做到的，你自己会有什么样的储备，那样的一段旅程又将是什么样的？

Bond邦德, 卡丽·雅格布斯((1862-1946) 美国歌曲与歌词作家, 他的作品有“真诚爱你”(1901年)和“佳日之末”(1910年)等)
时态:bonded, bonding, bonds名 词:bonder

sentences.chinese: 该定价方式允许组织只为他们在其仓库中管理的压缩的用户数据量进行付费。

detailed_translations.english: a large building for storing large quantities of goods

name: adjourn
trans: vt. 推迟；使…中止；使…延期
时态:adjourned, adjourning, adjourns名 词:adjournment

sentences.english: The rest of us adjourned to a nearby pub for some refreshments.
sentences.chinese: 我们其他人转移阵地，去了附近酒吧吃点心。

detailed_translations.english: to finish an activity and go somewhere – often used humorously

name: agreement
trans: n. 协定, 协议, 契约达成协议同意

sentences.english: They had made an agreement that they would share the profits equally.
sentences.chinese: 他们达成协议，平分利润。

sentences.english: Would their discussion result in his agreement to visit his stepmother?
sentences.chinese: 他们商量后，他会不会同意去看望继母？

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement or promise to do something, made by two or more people, companies, organizations etc

sentences.english: constitutional amendments
sentences.chinese: 宪法修正案

detailed_translations.english: a small change, improvement, or addition that is made to a law or document, or the process of doing this

sentences.english: The president has already given his approval to the plan.
sentences.chinese: 总统已经批准了这个计划。

sentences.english: It is just three months since we received official approval to go ahead with the project.
sentences.chinese: 三个月前我们刚刚得到正式批准进行这个项目。

sentences.english: A company cannot be sold without the approval of the shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 没有股东的同意不能出售公司。

sentences.english: The bill will be submitted for approval by Congress.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案将提交国会通过。

sentences.english: The President would appoint the Council of Ministers, subject to the approval of the National Assembly.
sentences.chinese: 总统将任命内阁成员，但需经国民议会批准。

sentences.english: The IMF has given its seal of approval to the government’s economic strategy.
sentences.chinese: 国际货币基金组织已经同意该政府的经济策略。

sentences.english: appointments requiring parliamentary approval
sentences.chinese: 需经议会批准的任命

sentences.english: She looked to Greg for approval.
sentences.chinese: 她指望格雷格同意。

detailed_translations.english: when a plan, decision, or person is officially accepted

name: attentive
trans: adj. 对某人〔物〕 注意的;留心的;警惕的殷勤的;体贴的彬彬有礼的副 词:attentively

sentences.english: an attentive audience
sentences.chinese: 聚精会神的听众

detailed_translations.english: listening to or watching someone carefully because you are interested

name: board
trans: n. 板, 牌子, 黑板纸板, 木板委员会, 董事会(包饭的)伙食
vt. 用木板覆盖或封闭上(船、车或飞机)
vt. & vi. 搭伙(并寄宿), 收费供膳食(及住宿)

sentences.english: a board meeting
sentences.chinese: 董事会会议

sentences.english: a board member
sentences.chinese: 董事会成员

detailed_translations.english: a group of people in a company or other organization who make the rules and important decisions

name: brainstorm
trans: n.脑猝病，(短暂的)突发性精神错乱计上心头，灵机一动；突来的灵感集体研讨；集思广益
vt. 集中各人智慧猛攻

sentences.english: While some of the greatest ideas and solutions come up in brainstorm meetings, we also lose most of our time in discussion without action.
sentences.chinese: 当在头脑风暴的会议上有一些顶级的主意或者解决方法提出时，我们也浪费了很多时间在没有行动的讨论上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集思广益；头脑风暴；灵机一动
集体讨论；集思广益以寻找

name: concede
trans: 时态:conceded, conceding, concedes副 词:concededly

sentences.english: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so,’ Charles conceded.
sentences.chinese: “那是唯一可行的解决办法。”“对，我想是。”查尔斯承认道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认， 承认…为真； 承认失败； 允许， 让予； 让步， 认输
detailed_translations.english: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

name: conference
trans: n. 会议讨论, 商谈形容词:conferential

sentences.english: Representatives from over 100 countries attended the International Peace Conference in Geneva.
sentences.chinese: 来自一百多个国家的代表出席了在日内瓦举行的国际和平大会。

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting where a lot of people discuss important matters such as business, politics, or science, especially for several days

name: convention
trans: n. (某一职业、政党等的人士召开的)大会习俗, 惯例协议, 协定

sentences.english: a teachers’ convention
sentences.chinese: 教师大会

sentences.english: the city’s new convention center
sentences.chinese: 该市新建的会议中心

sentences.english: a convention for science fiction fans
sentences.chinese: 科幻小说迷的集会

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting for people who belong to the same profession or organization or who have the same interests

name: convince
trans: vt. 使确信，使信服；说服

sentences.english: Although I soon convinced him of my innocence, I think he still has serious doubts about my sanity.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我很快就使他相信我是清白的，但是他还是非常怀疑我精神是否正常。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something convinces you of something, they make you believe that it is true or that it exists

name: cross-reference
trans: n. (同一书中的)互相参照,互见,对照处
vt. 为…编制互相参照使参见

name: delegate
trans: n. 代表, 代表团成员
vt. 任命或委派…为代表托付

sentences.english: Around 350 delegates attended the conference.
sentences.chinese: 大约有350名代表参加了大会。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group

detailed_translations.chinese: 委派…为代表； 授 ， 把…委托给
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group, organization etc

name: demand
trans: vt. 要求需要想要知道, 查问
n. 要求, 所需求之物需求, 需要

sentences.english: Angry demonstrators demanded the resignation of two senior officials.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的示威者要求两名高级官员辞职。

sentences.english: ‘Where are you going?’ she demanded angrily.
sentences.chinese: “你要去哪里？” 她气愤地质问道。

detailed_translations.english: to ask for something very firmly, especially because you think you have a right to do this
the need or desire that people have for particular goods and services

name: dispute
trans: vt. 辩论；阻止；抗拒；怀疑
时态:disputed, disputing, disputes名 词:disputer

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: negotiation
trans: n. 协商，谈判完成(难事)；通过

sentences.english: The trader was obstinate in the negotiation.
sentences.chinese: 这个商人在谈判中拗强固执。

detailed_translations.english: official discussions between the repre­sentatives of opposing groups who are trying to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: persuade
trans: vt. & vi. 说服, 劝告

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

name: postpone
trans: vt. 使…延期；把…放在次要地位；把…放在后面
vi. 延缓，延迟；延缓发作
时态:postponed, postponing, postpones名 词:postponement

sentences.english: The match had to be postponed until next week.
sentences.chinese: 比赛不得不推迟到下周举行。

sentences.english: His trial has been postponed indefinitely (= no one knows when it will happen ) .
sentences.chinese: 对他的审判被无限期推迟了。

detailed_translations.english: to change the date or time of a planned event or action to a later one

name: reconcile
trans: vt. 使和好；和解使一致，使和谐

sentences.english: The possibility remains that the two theories may be reconciled.
sentences.chinese: 这两种理论仍是有可能协调的。

sentences.english: The pair were reconciled after Jackson made a public apology.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊公开道歉之后，这两个人又言归于好了。

detailed_translations.english: if you reconcile two ideas, situations, or facts, you find a way in which they can both be true or acceptable

name: settlement
trans: n. 解决，和解，协议移民移居地，新住宅区〈律〉金钱或财产的转让(契约)；转让的金钱或财产结算，清偿

sentences.english: Union leaders and company bosses will meet tomorrow in an attempt to reach a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 工会领导人和公司老板将于明天举行会议以期达成协议。

sentences.english: His lawyers are understood to be negotiating a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 据说他的律师正在商谈一个协议。

sentences.english: Hopes grew that a workable peace settlement might emerge.
sentences.chinese: 达成一项可行的和平协定的希望越来越大。

sentences.english: She got her home as part of the divorce settlement .
sentences.chinese: 根据离婚协议，她拿到了房子。

sentences.english: The company paid out over $10 million in an out-of-court settlement .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司花了1,000多万美元进行庭外和解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解决； 协议； 居留地， 小社区
detailed_translations.english: an official agreement or decision that ends an argument, a court case, or a fight, or the action of making an agreement

name: agenda
trans: n. （政治）议题；议事日程；目的

sentences.english: The Republicans have stuck to their conservative agenda.
sentences.chinese: 共和党人坚持自己的保守议题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 议程；日常工作事项；日程表
detailed_translations.english: a list of problems or subjects that a government, organization etc is planning to deal with

name: alternative
trans: adj. 可供选择的, 可供替代的（较常用以指两项而非多项之间的选择）不寻常的, 非传统性的非正统的
n. （尤指不同于平常事物的）可供选择的事物；可供选择的解决办法替代物副 词:alternatively

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

name: announce
trans: vt. 宣布；述说；预示；播报
vi. 宣布参加竞选；当播音员

sentences.english: All visitors to the apartment building must be announced.
sentences.chinese: 那幢公寓楼的访客都必须通报。

sentences.english: After announcing himself at the reception desk, James was led upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 在接待处通报姓名后，詹姆斯被领上楼去。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell people that someone has arrived at a particular place

name: articulate
trans: adj. 表达能力强的口齿清楚的，发音清晰的
vt. & vi. 清楚地表达形成关节；(用关节)连接

sentences.english: Many people are unable to articulate the unhappiness they feel.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都表达不出内心的痛苦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 清晰地发（音）；明确有力地表达；用关节连接；使相互连贯
detailed_translations.english: to express your ideas or feelings in words

detailed_translations.chinese: 发音清晰的；口才好的；有关节的
detailed_translations.english: writing or speech that is articulate is very clear and easy to understand even if the subject is difficult

name: attorney
trans: n. 代理人, 律师名 词:attorneyship

sentences.english: ...a prosecuting attorney.
sentences.chinese: …一位公诉律师。

detailed_translations.english: a lawyer

name: breakthrough
trans: n. 突破点, 突破性进展, 重要的新发现

sentences.english: The company looks poised to make a significant breakthrough in China.
sentences.chinese: 该公司看上去稳将在中国实现一次重大突破。

detailed_translations.english: an important new discovery in something you are studying, especially one made after trying for a long time

name: compromise
trans: n. 妥协, 折中方法
vt. 连累, 危害, 损害

sentences.english: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妥协； 危及； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement

name: conclusive
trans: adj. 令人信服的,确凿的ad
v. 令人信服地,确凿地副 词:conclusively

sentences.english: Her attorneys claim there is no conclusive evidence that any murders took place.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师们声称没有任何发生过谋杀的确凿证据。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的； 最后的； 决定性的
detailed_translations.english: showing that something is definitely true

name: consensus
trans: n. (意见等)一致, 一致同意

sentences.english: The EU Council of Finance Ministers failed to reach a consensus on the pace of integration.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟财政部长会议未能就一体化的进度达成共识。

sentences.english: the current consensus of opinion
sentences.chinese: 目前观点上的一致

sentences.english: The general consensus was that technology was a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 大家都认为科技是好东西。

sentences.english: the consensus politics of the fifties
sentences.chinese: 50年代的共识政治

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

name: converse
trans: adj. 相反的，逆向的；颠倒的
n. 相反的事物；逆行，逆向；倒
时态:conversed, conversing, converses副 词:conversely

sentences.english: It lets me converse with the distinct voices of my past and quilt together a narrative about movement in place.
sentences.chinese: 它让我能够用可以彰显我的过去的独特声音与人交谈，并拼凑出一通有关地点变换的叙述。

sentences.english: From outside, from those who you love, converse, and make community with, telling you that you belong with them, if only you will give up those annoying, unacceptable parts, please.
sentences.chinese: 来自外界，来自那些你爱的、与你谈话的、与你团结在一起并告诉你你属于他们的人，只要你将放弃那些恼人的、无法接受的部分。

detailed_translations.english: to have a conversation with someone
opposite
the converse of a fact, word, statement etc is the opposite of it

name: criterion
trans: n. (批评、判断等的)标准, 准则形容词:criterial

sentences.english: the criteria we use to select candidates
sentences.chinese: 我们挑选候选人的标准

detailed_translations.english: a standard that you use to judge something or make a decision about something

name: decline
trans: vt. & vi. 辞谢；谢绝(邀请等)

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

name: demonstration
trans: n. 表明;证明;示范游行示威

sentences.english: Supporters staged a demonstration outside the US embassy.
sentences.chinese: 支持者在美国大使馆外举行了示威游行。

sentences.english: Police opened fire on a peaceful demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 警察朝和平示威的人群开了枪。

detailed_translations.english: an event at which a large group of people meet to protest or to support something in public

name: diplomacy
trans: n. 外交, 外交手腕, 外交术交际手腕, 处世之道

sentences.english: international diplomacy
sentences.chinese: 国际外交

detailed_translations.chinese: 外交；外交手腕；交际手段
detailed_translations.english: the job or activity of managing the relationships between countries

name: dissuade
trans: vt. 劝(某人)勿做某事；劝阻

sentences.english: Doctors had tried to dissuade patients from smoking.
sentences.chinese: 医生曾试图说服病人不要抽烟。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone not to do something

name: petition
trans: n. 请愿；祈求；请愿书；[律]诉状

sentences.english: Local residents have drawn up a petition to protest the hospital closure.
sentences.chinese: 当地居民已草拟了一份请愿书，抗议关闭医院。

sentences.english: Villagers petitioned the local authority to provide better bus services.
sentences.chinese: 村民请愿要求地方当局提供更好的公共汽车服务。

detailed_translations.english: a written request signed by a lot of people, asking someone in authority to do something or change something
to ask the government or an organization to do something by sending them a petition

name: premise
trans: vt. 引出，预先提出；作为…的前提
n. 前提；上述各项；房屋连地基

sentences.english: Schools may earn extra money by renting out their premises.
sentences.chinese: 学校通过出租房屋场地可以获取额外收入。

sentences.english: business premises
sentences.chinese: 企业经营场所

detailed_translations.chinese: 房屋和地基， 经营场址； 前提， 假设
detailed_translations.english: the buildings and land that a shop, restaurant, company etc uses

sentences.english: a Shakespeare seminar
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚研讨班

detailed_translations.english: a class at a university or college for a small group of students and a teacher to study or discuss a particular subject

name: statement
trans: n. 声明, 陈述结算单, 报表

sentences.english: In an official statement, she formally announced her resignation.
sentences.chinese: 在一份官方声明中，她正式宣布辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈述， 声明； 结算单， 报表
detailed_translations.english: something you say or write, especially publicly or officially, to let people know your intentions or opinions, or to record facts

name: advance
trans: vt. & vi. (使)前进，(使)发展；促进提高，提升
vt. 提出提前预付，贷(款项等)
n. 前进，发展，改进，进步增长，提高借款，预付款，贷款
adj. 预先的，在前的预先做好的；预先供给的

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

name: capacity
trans: n. 能力；容量；生产力；资格，地位

sentences.english: The room had seating capacity for about 80.
sentences.chinese: 这房间能坐80个人左右。

sentences.english: The orchestra played to a capacity crowd (= the largest number of people who can fit into a hall, theatre etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 管弦乐队为满场的观众演奏。

sentences.english: All the hotels were filled to capacity.
sentences.chinese: 所有的宾馆都住满了。

sentences.english: a child’s capacity for learning
sentences.chinese: 孩子的学习能力

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space a container, room etc has to hold things or people

name: component
trans: n. 成分, 组成部分, 部件, 元件形容词:componential

sentences.english: Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫没能使苏联各组成部分保持在一起。

detailed_translations.english: the component parts of something are the parts that it consists of
one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

sentences.english: modern labour-saving devices
sentences.chinese: 省力的现代设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械， 装置； 设计； 手段， 策略
detailed_translations.english: a machine or tool that does a special job

name: engineer
trans: n. 工程师；工兵；火车司机
vt. 策划；设计；精明地处理

sentences.english: He trained as a civil engineer (= one who designs and builds roads, bridges etc ).
sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design or build roads, bridges, machines etc

name: facilitate
trans: vt. 使便利, 减轻…的困难
时态:facilitated, facilitating, facilitates名 词:facilitator

sentences.english: The new trade agreement should facilitate more rapid economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 新贸易协定应当会加快经济发展。

sentences.english: Structured teaching facilitates learning.
sentences.chinese: 有条理的教导有利于学习。

name: jotdown
trans: Definition of jot in English: jot verbjotting, jotted, jots dʒɒtdʒɑt[with object]Write (something) quickly. when you've found the answers, jot them down Example sentencesExamples Rebecca jotted it down and agreed to come over to Mark's house in about fifteen minutes. Duke hunted along the dashboard for a pen and jotted a few things in the borders of a curling menu. She recited Sarah's phone number to Larisa who jotted it down on a piece of paper. His gaze never left them as he neatly jotted notes down on a small notepad. She ripped out a piece of paper from one of her notebooks and jotted it dow

n. He jotted it down in a small notebook I hadn't noticed him holding before. We talked for a while, and after her coins ran out I jotted the number on the wood beside my phone and called her back. An instant after the last letter was jotted down, someone knocked on the door. She then thought of some ideas, jotted them down and started to write some sentences. I quickly jotted it down and handed it to him, and he quickly pocketed it. Miller might have jotted the name down, but then, she would have isolated it. One of the two policemen jotted notes in a leather bound pad while the other talked to Rick. He moved behind her and rubbed her neck as she jotted a few ideas down on paper. I quickly jotted several things down in my notebook and mentally cackled. The waitress immediately took out a piece of paper and a pen from her apron and jotted the notes dow
n. She jotted it down on her notepad and glanced at me briefly before turning to head back to the counter. All kinds of snippets of ideas for tunes kept popping into my head so I jotted them dow

n. As I told him, he jotted it down on his clipboard and read it back to me. He measured the length, and the diameter of the dart, and jotted it down in his small notepad. He then jotted a note to her while discussing the importance of family and the strength of prayer. Synonymswrite down, note down, make a note of, take down, set down, put down, put on paper, mark downlog, record, list, register, enterscribble, scrawlnounPlural jots dʒɒtdʒɑtusually with negative A very small amount. you didn't care a jot I have yet to see one jot of evidence Example sentencesExamples The truth is, it doesn't matter, not a jot, not a tittle. And the fact that Lesley is a woman did not matter one jot. Even the scientists who advocate for that protocol recognise that it will not make one jot of difference, even if it is fully implemented. She smiled uneasily at her friend who looked very much as though she cared not a jot for her record. It's not bad but neither is it brilliant - which won't bother 99 per cent of buyers one jot as they are in it for the image. No, I won't give away a jot of the plot here; the movie does that nicely enough. But I suspect Ferguson doesn't care a jot about the opinion of his colleagues. The saddest aspect is that it probably won't matter a jot. It makes not one jot of difference that no actual blood is visible on their hands. They were so helpless and vulnerable, yet didn't seem to care a jot, wanting only to play and charge around. I have said that the circumstances do not deserve one jot of sympathy. With the greatest of respect to the Ireland captain, he would not have made a jot of difference against such physical and technical ability. I'm finally ready for Christmas, and there's not a jot of snow to be found. They don't even care a jot whether you like the result. There is not one jot of evidence that such an experience actually occurred in the infancy of one of Freud's patients. It is a mystery, but a delightful one, even if you care not a jot for genealogy. The Arts Council grant freeze doesn't surprise me one jot. On the other hand, I don't care a jot for any of that. Now this surprised me not a jot because, like most non-social workers, I am a firm believer that kids who are allowed to do as they please grow up to be monsters. We have not heard one jot of policy from the National Party today - not one jot. Synonymsiota, scrap, shred, whit, grain, crumb, ounce, little bit, bit, tiniest bit, jot or tittle, fraction, speck, atom, particle, scintilla, trace, hint, miteanyrap, hoot, figIrish stimFrench soupçoninformal smidgen, smidge, tad, damn, tinker's cuss, monkey'sAustralian/New Zealand informal skerrickarchaic scantling, scruple, smitchOriginLate 15th century (as a noun): via Latin from Greek iōta, the smallest letter of the Greek alphabet : see iota.Greek iōta (ι), the smallest letter of the Greek alphabet, gave us jot as a word for a very small amount—‘i’ and ‘j’ being interchangeable forms in medieval writing. To stress that someone cannot have any part of something, we might use the phrase not one jot or not one iota, which reflects the warning given by Jesus in St Matthew's Gospel that ‘Till heaven and earth pass, one jot or tittle shall in no wise pass from the law’ (a tittle here is a small stroke or accent). To jot something down appeared in the early 18th century and seems to have developed from the idea of a short sharp action as in writing a jot.Rhymesallot, begot, Bernadotte, blot, bot, capot, clot, cocotte, cot, culotte, dot, forgot, garrotte (US garrote), gavotte, got, grot, hot, knot, lot, Mayotte, motte, not, Ott, outshot, plot, pot, rot, sans-culotte, Scot, Scott, shallot, shot, slot, snot, sot, spot, squat, stot, swat, swot, tot, trot, undershot, Wat, Watt, what, wot, yachtDefinition of jot in US English: jot verbjätdʒɑt[with object]Write (something) quickly. when you've found the answers, jot them down Example sentencesExamples An instant after the last letter was jotted down, someone knocked on the door. He measured the length, and the diameter of the dart, and jotted it down in his small notepad. He jotted it down in a small notebook I hadn't noticed him holding before. She then thought of some ideas, jotted them down and started to write some sentences. The waitress immediately took out a piece of paper and a pen from her apron and jotted the notes dow

n. I quickly jotted it down and handed it to him, and he quickly pocketed it. His gaze never left them as he neatly jotted notes down on a small notepad. Miller might have jotted the name down, but then, she would have isolated it. She recited Sarah's phone number to Larisa who jotted it down on a piece of paper. As I told him, he jotted it down on his clipboard and read it back to me. He then jotted a note to her while discussing the importance of family and the strength of prayer. She ripped out a piece of paper from one of her notebooks and jotted it dow

n. He moved behind her and rubbed her neck as she jotted a few ideas down on paper. We talked for a while, and after her coins ran out I jotted the number on the wood beside my phone and called her back. Rebecca jotted it down and agreed to come over to Mark's house in about fifteen minutes. I quickly jotted several things down in my notebook and mentally cackled. Duke hunted along the dashboard for a pen and jotted a few things in the borders of a curling menu. All kinds of snippets of ideas for tunes kept popping into my head so I jotted them dow

There is not one jot of evidence that such an experience actually occurred in the infancy of one of Freud's patients. And the fact that Lesley is a woman did not matter one jot. I have said that the circumstances do not deserve one jot of sympathy. On the other hand, I don't care a jot for any of that. if a group of people convene, or someone convenes them, they come together, especially for a formal meeting

trans: n. 皮带扣，带扣Buckle巴克尔(姓氏)

n. 可改变性,可变化性副 词:convertibly

a car with a soft roof that you can fold back or remove

trans: vi. 碰撞；坠毁；闯；突然倒台
时态:crashed, crashing, crashes名 词:crasher

sentences.english: We watched the waves crashing against the rocks.

to have an accident in a car, plane etc by violently hitting something else
a sudden loud noise made by something falling, breaking etc

时态:delayed, delaying, delays名 词:delayer

sentences.chinese: 别犹豫——即刻去函索取信息。

trans: 时态:forbade , forbadforbidden , forbid forbidding, forbids名 词:forbiddance

sentences.chinese: 作为惩罚，他被禁止离开家。

sentences.chinese: 由于篇幅限制，无法列出所有捐款人的姓名。

vt. 打基础；使搁浅；使接触地面
adj. 土地的；地面上的；磨碎的；磨过的
v. 压迫；研磨（grind的过去分词）

sentences.chinese: 我发现她躺在地上。

sentences.english: a football/recreation/sports, etc. ground

sentences.chinese: 有充分的理由可以相信他的话。

sentences.english: ‘You’re under arrest.’ ‘On what grounds?’

detailed_translations.english: the solid surface of the earth

trans: vi. [口]乱穿马路（不遵守交通规则）
时态:jaywalked, jaywalking, jaywalks名 词:jaywalker

sentences.english: Pedestrians have to travel farther to cross the street legally unless they want to jaywalk.
sentences.chinese: 行人需要走远一点从斑马线上横过马路，除非他们想要乱穿马路。

sentences.english: Drivers routinely  overtake on the right, taxis breeze through red lights, cyclists ride against the traffic and pedestrians jaywalk.
sentences.chinese: 开车人常常从右侧超车，出租车闯红灯，骑自行车逆行，行人乱穿马路。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乱穿马路（不遵守交通规则）

n. 发射；下水；汽艇；发行，投放市场

sentences.chinese: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

sentences.english: a fighter pilot

A pilot plan or a pilot project is one that is used to test an idea before deciding whether to introduce it on a larger scale
to guide an aircraft, spacecraft, or ship as its pilot

name: route
trans: n. 路, 路途, 路线, 路程

a way from one place to another

vt. 使就座使就职可容纳若干座位

sentences.chinese: 我在后座，乔开车。

sentences.chinese: 万人体育场

sentences.chinese: 人们在座位上动来动去，看上去不大自在。

sentences.chinese: 他朝一把椅子一挥手，在桌旁坐了下来。

detailed_translations.english: If you seat yourself somewhere, you sit down

trans: art. 表示“一(个, 件…)(非特指的)一(个)(同类事物中的)任何一(个)(用于表示时间、速度、价格等意义的)每一(用在某些物质名词和抽象名词前)一阵、一场、一种Aabbr. ampere 安

sentences.chinese: 你的个人物品我们将以空运方式运送，家具将以海运方式运送。

sentences.chinese: 有些法律相互矛盾，因此，采取了措施将其阐明。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is appropriate to what has been done or said in a particular situation

sentences.chinese: 学习是一生的事。

sentences.english: You have your whole life ahead of you.
sentences.chinese: 你前面还有漫长的人生呢。

sentences.english: I’ve known John all my life (= since I was born ).
sentences.chinese: 我从小就认识约翰了。

sentences.english: His main aim in life was to have fun.
sentences.chinese: 他人生的主要目标就是享乐。

sentences.english: It was one of the best days of my life.
sentences.chinese: 那是我一生中最快乐的时光之一。

sentences.english: She married late in life (= when she was fairly old ).

name: accounting
trans: n. 会计；会计学；会计制度会计业务或能力账单；借贷对照表记账；结账；结算；决算人各有所好。

sentences.english: ...the accounting firm of Leventhal & Horwath.
sentences.chinese: …利文撒尔与霍瓦特会计事务所。

detailed_translations.english: accountancy

sentences.chinese: 所有受伤的行人中有1/3以上是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is walking, especially along a street or other place used by cars

name: restriction

sentences.english: a 50 mph speed restriction
sentences.chinese: 每小时50英里的限速

detailed_translations.english: a rule or law that limits or controls what people can do

name: achieve
trans: vt. 取得, 获得实现, 达到, 完成

sentences.chinese: 弗朗西丝考试取得了优异成绩。

sentences.english: Wilson has achieved considerable success as an artist.
sentences.chinese: 威尔逊作为一名艺术家成就斐然。

sentences.english: She eventually achieved her goal of becoming a professor.
sentences.chinese: 她终于实现目标，当上了教授。

sentences.chinese: 该飞机开始沿跑道滑行。

sentences.chinese: 我试着走近路，结果迷路了。

name: Dinning
trans: din1 nounPlural dins, Plural DINs dɪndɪnA loud, unpleasant, and prolonged noise. the fans made an awful din Example sentencesExamples I just didn't want to add my voice to the din of noise that has filled the public square regarding this tragic woman's fate. If you listen closely enough, you should be able to make out the angry words above the din: a cacophony of female voices raised to the rafters with one common message for their menfolk. I would have liked to converse with her a little further about the food sources, but the ear-deafening din meant that barking our orders to her was about all we could do. Animals added their noises to the din, poultry screeching and draft animals lowing as they were displayed and examined. Every England fan had a whooping, whistling counterpart so we shouted louder until the din was indescribable. ‘Go away, I'm busy’ he yelled above the din of the sewing machine. In an instant, it was clear that the ward was an intolerably noisy place, flooded with a near-continuous din of screams, laughter, and loud vocalizations. ‘Hello darling,’ said Lewis on the other end above a loud din in the background. ‘I want to come back when it's a bit quieter,’ I shouted over the din of amplified music, throbbing diesel generators and rattling joy rides. The people were inside and the radio was turned up loud to drown out the din of the men yelling and laughing as they drank coffee and beer. In the background I read that towards the end of its life as a chapel in the convict period, free settlers got very cross with the fact that the convicts were making an awful din from under their pews. The next moment his loud shout rose over the din of battle, and swinging his hat over his head for a banner to those who pressed after, he spurred against the flying enemy. A couple of days of silence make the din seem so much louder. Finding it difficult to handle them at home, many owners go in search of kennels where they are safely housed from the din and noise. The merry din of talk, laughter, music, and clattering dinnerware spills outside. It has something to do with the book reviewing climate and the endless din buzzing around readers and publishers alike. While attending the lectures, the din of clashes outside the campus was audible. People shout to be heard over the din, loud mufflerless trucks rumble by on the street, dogs bark, a mysterious polytonal chittering in the background sounds like a great horde of rats. Although its cries were becoming increasingly desperate as the din of barking and shouting intensified, the thought of trying to help never entered my mind. The plant is noisy, and she and her co-workers pass the time by shouting over the din, catching up on gossip and talking about food and cosmetics. We, meanwhile, struggle to din some culture into our own young people whose aspirations have been hijacked by the consumerism of big corporations. It is dinned into him that the wife must always be subordinate to the husband. Day after day he had to din it into her that persistent work, and not ability alone, was essential for success. It was dinned into us that wasting water was sinful. With the memory of all the talk against the man that had been dinned into her ears, I looked at her narrowly. A local teacher dinned into us some other principles of the game. I have noticed that a high proportion of men do not trouble to wash their hands after using public toilets - possibly partly due to hand-washing not having been dinned into them during childhood and partly due to a macho outlook. Neither does the narrative din it into the viewer. Only when the message that Labour isn't all that clever, after all, is dinned into the voters can National risk changing the subject to its own intentions. sentences.chinese: 这句话的意思是："我们六点钟的新闻节目有个问题。我们有四个候选人的片段，最好把四个片段都挤进去。不过，这就意味着我们得减少一些其他内容。"

detailed_translations.english: a news programme on radio or television

name: calculation
trans: n. 计算，计算(的结果)推断；预测，估计盘算，深思熟虑，慎重的计划自私的打算；算计形容词:calculative

trans: 时态:premiered, premièred premiering, premièring premieres, premières

sentences.chinese: 这位23岁的年轻演员，在粉丝们的热情欢呼声中到达了莱斯雷特广场，今晚是他最新电影《记住我》的首映式。

The premiere of a new play or movie is the first public performance of it

also cancelled cancelingcancelling cancelscancels名 词:canceler

trans: n. 取消，注销；作废，废除；删去，划掉被取消的事物(相)约；(相)消盖销记号；戳记

sentences.chinese: 火车乘客厌烦取消班次和误点的问题。

sentences.chinese: 剧作家在这场中有许多惊人妙笔，但并不给人留下竭力追求表面效果的印象。

sentences.chinese: 他的剧本被翻译成世界上多种主要语言，并且表演次数远远超过其他任何剧作家。

sentences.chinese: 他们买了一套新的桌椅。

name: circumstances
trans: circumstance3 ENTRIES FOUND:circumstance (noun)pomp (noun)reduce (verb)circumstance/ˈsɚkəmˌstæns/nounplural circumstancescircumstance/ˈsɚkəmˌstæns/ nounplural circumstancesLearner's definition of CIRCUMSTANCE1[count] : a condition or fact that affects a situation情况；条件I can't imagine a circumstance in/under which I would do that.我真想象不出自己在什么情形下能做出那样的事。— usually plural通常用复数If our business is to survive, we must be able to adapt to changing circumstances.如果我们想继续把生意做下去，我们必须能够适应千变万化的环境。It is impossible under these circumstances to meet our deadline.在这样的情况下，根本不可能如期完成。Do not, under any circumstances, open that door. = Under no circumstances are you to open that door. [=no matter what happens, do not open that door]无论如何都不要打开那扇门。Due to circumstances beyond our control [=things that have happened that we cannot change or influence], the flight is canceled.由于出现无法控制的情况，航班被取消。There is nothing we can do under the circumstances. [=in this specific situation]在这种情况下，我们毫无办法。Given the circumstances, I think we did well. [=when you consider how everything went, I think we did well]鉴于当时的情况，我认为我们做得够好了。2circumstances [plural] : the way something happens : the specific details of an event情况；细节；详情The circumstances of his death are suspicious.他死亡的情形十分可疑。3: an event or situation that you cannot control（非人力所能控制的）机缘，命运，机遇[noncount]She says that her client is a victim of circumstance and should not be blamed for the accident.她说她的委托人也是客观环境的受害者，不应把事故的责任推给他。[plural]He was a victim of circumstances.他是客观环境的牺牲品。4circumstances [plural] : the conditions in which someone lives境遇；境况；经济状况Their circumstances changed dramatically after she lost her job.她失业后他们的经济状况发生了巨大的变化。I don't know anything about his financial circumstances. [=about how much money he has]我对他的经济状况一无所知。They have been forced to live in reduced circumstances. [=to live with less money]他们被迫过着紧巴巴的日子。pomp and circumstance—see pomp

detailed_translations.english: similar to something else in size, number, quality etc, so that you can make a comparison

trans: 时态:massaged, massaging, massages名 词:massager

sentences.chinese: 亚历克斯给海伦娜疼痛的背部做了推拿。

the action of pressing and rubbing someone’s body with your hands, to help them relax or to reduce pain in their muscles or joints

name: compare
trans: 时态:compared, comparing, compares名 词:comparer

sentences.english: The report compares the different types of home computer available.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告比较了市场上不同类型的家用计算机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 把…比作
detailed_translations.english: to consider two or more things or people, in order to show how they are similar or different

sentences.english: Relax your stomach muscles , then stretch again.
sentences.chinese: 放松腹部肌肉，然后再绷紧。

sentences.english: Regular exercise will help to strengthen your muscles .
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼有助于强健肌肉。

sentences.english: It took muscle to work in an old-fashioned kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 在老式厨房里干活很费力。

trans: adj. 可以并存的, 相容的, 协调的副 词:compatibly

sentences.english: The new software is IBM compatible (= can be used with IBM computers ) .
sentences.chinese: 这个新软件与IBM的计算机兼容。

detailed_translations.english: if two pieces of computer equipment are compatible, they can be used together, especially when they are made by different companies

sentences.english: Reading was her favourite pastime.
sentences.chinese: 阅读是她最喜爱的消遣方式。

detailed_translations.english: something that you do because you think it is enjoyable or interesting

name: compensate
trans: vt. & vi. 补偿, 报酬

sentences.english: the government’s promise to compensate victims of the flood
sentences.chinese: 政府对水灾灾民给予补偿的许诺

sentences.english: The firm will compensate workers for their loss of earnings.
sentences.chinese: 公司将补偿工人的收入损失。

trans: n. 裁判员；调解人；介绍人

sentences.chinese: 他的校长同意做他的推荐人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who makes sure that the rules of a sport such as football,  basketball  , or  boxing  , are followed
to be the referee of a game

name: spectator
trans: n. 观众, 旁观者形容词:spectatorial

sentences.english: The match attracted over 40,000 spectators.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is watching an event or game

sentences.english: Going to trade fairs is an ideal opportunity to size up the competition .
sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

name: stretch
trans: 时态:stretched, stretching, stretches名 词:stretchability

sentences.english: Carl sat up in bed, yawned, and stretched.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔从床上坐起来，打了个呵欠，伸了伸懒 腰。

sentences.english: Always stretch before exercising.
sentences.chinese: 锻炼之前都要做伸展运动。

to reach a long way for something

detailed_translations.chinese: 一段时间； 一段距离；延伸， 连绵； 连绵的一片
detailed_translations.english: a continuous period of time

sentences.english: Competitive sports encourage children to work together as a team.
sentences.chinese: 竞技体育鼓励孩子们进行团队协作。

sentences.english: Advertising is an intensely competitive business.
sentences.chinese: 广告业是一个竞争激烈的行业。

detailed_translations.english: relating to competition

sentences.chinese: 我们在夏威夷时每天都去冲浪。

detailed_translations.english: the activity or sport of riding over the waves on a special board

trans: n. 方法, 策略战术, 兵法

sentences.chinese: 你以前也可能听说过这个策略。

sentences.english: Over the next few months, however, that tactic will be difficult to sustain.
sentences.chinese: 然而在接下去的几个月这个策略将很难维持下去。

sentences.english: Residents are complaining because traffic in the area has increased.
sentences.chinese: 由于这个地区的交通流量有所增加，居民都在抱怨。

sentences.english: ‘You never ask my opinion about anything,’ Rod complained.
sentences.chinese: “你什么事都不问问我的看法。”罗德抱怨道。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you are annoyed, not satisfied, or unhappy about something or someone

sentences.chinese: 她渴望参加比赛。

sentences.chinese: 他们在划船比赛中输了两场比赛，并被淘汰出局。

sentences.chinese: 他已拿定主意不参加比赛了，你再将他也没有用。

name: complaint
trans: n. 抱怨, 诉苦投诉, 控告疾病

sentences.chinese: 如果你要投诉，应该去找经理。

sentences.english: The sales assistants are trained to deal with customer complaints in a friendly manner.
sentences.chinese: 售货员都受过培训，要以友好的态度处理顾客的投诉。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which someone complains about something

name: umpire
trans: n. 裁判员；仲裁人；裁决者

sentences.chinese: 他过去担任棒球比赛的裁判。

name: complete
trans: adj. 完整的, 完全的完成的, 结束的完满的, 圆满的彻底的, 完完全全的
vt. 完成, 结束使完善比较级:completer, completest 缩 写:comp, cpl

sentences.english: Students must complete the course.
sentences.chinese: 学生必须学完这门课程。

sentences.english: The building took two years to complete.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼花了两年时间才完工。

sentences.english: The darkness was almost complete.
sentences.chinese: 几乎是漆黑一片。

sentences.english: a complete stranger

used to emphasize that a quality or situation is as great as it could possibly be

sentences.english: I like playing beach volleyball.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢打沙滩排球。

sentences.english: Every sunday, they played volleyball in the park.
sentences.chinese: 每个周日他们在公园打排球。

sentences.english: Balloon, baseball, basketball, football and volleyball all dance  ballet on the  volcano.
sentences.chinese: 气球、棒球、篮球、足球和排球都在火山上跳芭蕾舞。

detailed_translations.english: a game in which two teams use their hands to hit a ball over a high net

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

sentences.english: The rise in crime is mainly due to social and economic factors.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率上升主要由社会和经济因素造成。

name: alleviate
trans: vt. 减轻, 缓解, 缓和
时态:alleviated, alleviating, alleviates名 词:alleviation

sentences.english: measures to alleviate poverty
sentences.chinese: 扶贫措施

detailed_translations.english: to make something less painful or difficult to deal with

name: complexity
trans: n. 复杂性,错综复杂的状态复杂的事物

sentences.chinese: 一项非常复杂的设计

detailed_translations.english: the state of being complicated

sentences.chinese: 实际上，这些细菌有的对你是很有好处的。

sentences.english: When you eat off the plate, all of those bacteria go into your stomach.
sentences.chinese: 当你吃掉了盘子里的食物时，这些细菌就会进入你的肚子。

sentences.chinese: 但是她正确地指出细菌无处不在：在我们身上，在我们体内以及在我们周围。

sentences.chinese: 218号公路上有两辆汽车迎面相撞，两人死亡。

v. 崇敬地,赞美地,赞许地

sentences.chinese: 酒店客房里有一瓶免费赠送的香槟。

sentences.chinese: 我有几张今晚的免费戏票。

name: compensation
trans: n. 补偿[赔偿]物, 补偿[赔偿]金

sentences.chinese: 道德水准普遍下降。

sentences.chinese: 我们一旦得过这种病，就获得了终身免疫力。

trans: n. 调查者;审查者形容词:investigatorial

sentences.chinese: 警探

detailed_translations.english: someone who investigates things, especially crimes

name: conclude
trans: vt. 结束；推断；决定，作结论

sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

trans: adj. 命令的;强制的;义务的

sentences.chinese: 谋杀罪依照法律要判无期徒刑。

sentences.chinese: 这些就是这篇报告的主要结论。

sentences.chinese: 警方得出了无法回避的结论: 这些儿童被谋杀了。

sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

name: outpatient

sentences.chinese: 门诊诊所

sentences.english: a routine examination in outpatients
sentences.chinese: 在医院门诊部的例行检查

detailed_translations.english: someone who goes to a hospital for treatment but does not stay for the night

name: condition
trans: n. 状况，状态；地位健康状况，可使用的状况条件，先决条件环境，情况疾病
vt. 制约，限制使习惯于，使适应

sentences.english: Profits increased by £1.5m, despite the difficult economic conditions.
sentences.chinese: 尽管经济形势不佳，利润还是增长了150万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the state that something is in, especially how good or bad its physical state is

name: premium

adj. （品质）高级的；优质的，顶级的

sentences.english: premium ice cream
sentences.chinese: 优质冰激凌

sentences.english: the current consumer trend for premium products
sentences.chinese: 当前消费者喜欢购买优质产品的趋向

sentences.english: premium quality British potatoes
sentences.chinese: 优质英国马铃薯

detailed_translations.chinese: 高级的，优质的；售价高的
detailed_translations.english: of very high quality

detailed_translations.chinese: 保险金；额外费用，加付款；奖品，赠品；额外津贴
detailed_translations.english: the cost of insurance, especially the amount that you pay each year

name: conduct
