n. 行为举止；管理（方式），实施（办法）；引导
时态:conducted, conducting, conducts名 词:conductibility

sentences.english: The Senator’s conduct is being investigated by the Ethics Committee.
sentences.chinese: 该参议员的行为正受到道德委员会的调查。

sentences.english: an inquiry into the conduct of the police
sentences.chinese: 对警方行为的调查

sentences.english: his arrest for disorderly conduct
sentences.chinese: 他因妨害治安行为而遭逮捕

detailed_translations.chinese: 举止， 行为； 指导； 管理； 实施
detailed_translations.english: the way someone behaves, especially in public, in their job etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行； 管理， 指挥， 引导； 传输， 传导
detailed_translations.english: to stand in front of a group of musicians or singers and direct their playing or singing

name: severe
trans: adj. 严厉的；苛刻的；剧烈的；严峻的比较级:severer, severest副 词:severely

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

name: confirm
trans: vt. 确认；批准；证实；确定；使巩固
时态:confirmed, confirming, confirms名 词:confirmability

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

name: stroke
trans: n. 一击一画，一笔(游泳或划船的)划，划法；游法钟的敲声中风轻抚

sentences.english: She died following a massive stroke.
sentences.chinese: 她重度中风后去世了。

sentences.english: a stroke patient
sentences.chinese: 中风患者

sentences.english: His punishment was six strokes of the cane.
sentences.chinese: 给他的惩罚是挨六教鞭。

sentences.english: At the first stroke it will be 9 o'clock exactly.
sentences.chinese: 等到钟敲第一下时就是9点整。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly

name: terms
trans: n. 条款；地位，关系；措辞；术语；价钱（term的复数形式）
v. 把…称为（term的三单形式）

sentences.english: Myocardial infarction is the medical term for a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 心肌梗塞是心脏病发作的医学术语。

sentences.english: He had been termed a temporary employee.
sentences.chinese: 他曾被称为临时工。

detailed_translations.chinese: 地位，关系；[法] 条款；术语；措辞；价钱（term的复数形式）
detailed_translations.english: A term is a word or expression with a specific meaning, especially one which is used in relation to a particular subject
If you say that something is termed a particular thing, you mean that that is what people call it or that is their opinion of it

name: confusion
trans: n. 困惑, 糊涂混淆, 混同混乱, 骚乱

sentences.english: a scene of indescribable confusion
sentences.chinese: 难以形容的混乱场面

sentences.english: To avoid confusion, the teams wore different colours.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免混淆，各队穿着不同颜色的服装。

detailed_translations.english: a very confusing situation, that usually has a lot of noise and action, so that it is difficult for someone to understand it or control it

name: vital
trans: adj. 极重要的，必不可少的维持生命所必需的；生命的有生气的，充满生机的副 词:vitally

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

sentences.english: We’d like two rooms with connecting doors (= doors that join the rooms ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们想要两个有门相通的房间。

sentences.english: I didn’t connect the two events in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我心里没把这两件事联系起来。

detailed_translations.english: to join two or more things together

name: antibiotic
trans: n. 抗生素, 抗菌素

sentences.english: "If you can stop the enzymes involved in that process with a small molecule or chemical," says Dunman, "that chemical could be an antibiotic.
sentences.chinese: “如果能用一小分子或化学物质阻止这一酶的活性过程，”德明说，“这种化学物质就能够用来做抗生素。”

sentences.english: If we all recognize that antibiotic resistance is one of the greatest threats to public health that we face today, we have to do something about this.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们大家都能认识到耐抗生素（药性）已经成为我们今天面对的最大的公众健康威胁之一，我们就真的需要做点什么了。

detailed_translations.english: a drug that is used to kill  bacteria  and cure infections

name: connection
trans: n. 连接，联结联系；关系连接点；连接物熟人，业务上的客户

sentences.english: Police have so far failed to establish a connection between the two murders.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止警方尚未确定两宗凶杀案之间有关联。

sentences.english: The evidence was there in the file but no one made the connection .
sentences.chinese: 证据就在档案里，但没有人把它们联系起来。

sentences.english: Students often see little connection between school and the rest of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 学生往往看不到上学和今后生活的联系。

sentences.english: He demonstrated the close connection between social conditions and health.
sentences.chinese: 他证明了社会条件和健康之间的密切联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连接； 联系； 连接物， 连接点； 亲戚
detailed_translations.english: the way in which two facts, ideas, events etc are related to each other, and one is affected or caused by the other

name: claim
trans: vt. 声称, 断言(灾难等)使失踪或死亡需要, 值得
vt. & vi. 对…提出要求, 索取
n. 主张, 断言要求

sentences.english: I don’t claim to be a feminist, but I’d like to see more women in top jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我不会自称是女权主义者，但我希望看到更多的女性担任高职。

sentences.english: Opposition leaders will claim victory if the turnout is lower than 50%.
sentences.chinese: 如果投票率低于 50%，反对党领袖将宣布获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声称，主张；对…提出要求，索取；使失踪或死亡；需要，值得
detailed_translations.english: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求； 认领； 索赔； 声称， 断言
detailed_translations.english: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

name: consequence
trans: n. 结果, 后果重要(性), 重大

sentences.english: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

name: commission
trans: n. 授权, 委托委员会佣金, 回扣

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

name: consider
trans: vt. 把…看作, 认为关心, 体谅, 顾及

sentences.english: We will have to consider your offer carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们得仔细考虑你的提议。

sentences.english: The local authority considered that the school did not meet requirements.
sentences.chinese: 当地政府认为这所学校达不到要求。

sentences.english: Have you considered my feelings?
sentences.chinese: 你考虑过我的感受吗？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something carefully, especially before making a choice or decision

name: comprehensive
trans: adj. 广泛的, 综合的副 词:comprehensively

sentences.english: We offer our customers a comprehensive range of financial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们为客户提供全面的金融产品。

sentences.english: a comprehensive guide to British hotels and restaurants
sentences.chinese: 一本介绍英国酒店和餐厅的详尽指南

sentences.english: The following guidelines do not aim to be totally comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 以下指导原则并非想要面面俱到。

detailed_translations.english: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

name: considerable
trans: adj. 相当大(或多)的副 词:considerably

sentences.english: Michael has already spent considerable time in Barcelona.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔在巴塞罗那已经待了相当长的时间了。

sentences.english: issues of considerable importance
sentences.chinese: 相当重要的问题

sentences.english: The series has aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 这套系列节目引起了观众相当浓厚的兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large, especially large enough to have an effect or be important

name: coverage
trans: n. 新闻报道, 报道量覆盖范围

sentences.english: live coverage of the match (= the match is broadcast at the same time that it is happening )
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛的现场直播

detailed_translations.english: when a subject or event is reported on television or radio, or in newspapers

name: consignment
trans: n. 托付货物;托卖货物寄售;托运;托付;交付以寄售方式

sentences.english: The first consignment of food was flown in yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 第一批食品昨天空运到了。

detailed_translations.english: a quantity of goods that are sent somewhere, especially in order to be sold

sentences.english: How did they diagnose you?
sentences.chinese: 他们怎么给你的诊断的？

sentences.english: What tools do you need to help you diagnose the problem, and where do you get them?
sentences.chinese: 您需要什么工具来帮助您诊断问题，可以从哪里获得这些工具？

sentences.english: Evidently this springs from some defect in their nature, but it is one not altogether easy either to diagnose of to cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形显然源于他们本性上的某种缺陷，但是这种缺陷既不容易诊断也不容易治疗。

detailed_translations.english: to find out what illness someone has, or what the cause of a fault is, after doing tests, examinations etc

name: consist
trans: vi. 组成, 构成在于, 存在于

sentences.english: My diet consisted almost exclusively of chocolate-covered cookies and glasses of milk.
sentences.chinese: 我的饮食几乎只包含裹上巧克力的曲奇饼和一杯杯牛奶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由…组成； 在于； 一致

name: consistent
trans: adj. 一贯的, 始终如一的一致的, 符合的副 词:consistently

sentences.english: We need to be consistent in our approach.
sentences.chinese: 我们在方法上要前后一致。

detailed_translations.english: always behaving in the same way or having the same attitudes, standards etc – usually used to show approval

name: fraud
trans: n. 欺诈, 欺骗行为骗子

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["electoral fraud"]}
sentences.chinese: 选举欺诈

sentences.english: She was found guilty of fraud.
sentences.chinese: 她被判犯有诈骗罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺诈， 诈骗； 骗子
detailed_translations.english: the crime of deceiving people in order to gain something such as money or goods

name: consistently
trans: v. 一贯地;坚持地；固守地

sentences.english: Instead, we should be articulating guidelines that answer consistently the questions: Who should we support in the Middle East?
sentences.chinese: 而我们应该作为回答这一系列一致问题的清晰指向标。 例如，“在中东我们应该支持谁？”

name: handicap
trans: n. 障碍(生理或智力上的)缺陷；残疾加给强对手的不利条件
vt. 妨碍；使不利使(某人)行动和生活不正常

sentences.english: Not speaking the language is a real handicap.
sentences.chinese: 不会讲这种语言的确是一个障碍。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that makes it difficult for someone to do what they want
to make it difficult for someone to do something that they want or need to do

name: constant
trans: adj. 始终如一的, 恒久不变的不断的, 连续发生的忠实的, 忠诚的副 词:constantly

sentences.english: There was a constant stream of visitors to the house.
sentences.chinese: 参观这幢房子的游客川流不息。

sentences.english: Amy lived in constant fear of being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 埃米一直生活在害怕遭到袭击的恐惧之中。

sentences.english: He kept in constant contact with his family while he was in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚时一直和家人保持着联系。

sentences.english: travelling at a constant speed
sentences.chinese: 以恒定速度行驶

detailed_translations.english: happening regularly or all the time

name: indemnity
trans: n. 保障, 赔偿, 补偿赔款, 补偿金, 赔偿物

sentences.english: insurance providing indemnity against future liabilities
sentences.chinese: 对将来的债务提供保障的保险

detailed_translations.english: protection against loss or damage, especially in the form of a promise to pay for any losses or damage

sentences.english: He talked constantly about his work.
sentences.chinese: 他不断地谈到他的工作。

sentences.english: The English language is constantly changing .
sentences.chinese: 英语在不断地变化。

detailed_translations.english: all the time, or very often

name: intensive
trans: adj. 加强的, 集中的, 密集的彻底的加强语气的副 词:intensively

sentences.english: a one-week intensive course in English
sentences.chinese: 为期一周的英语强化课程

sentences.english: a day of intensive negotiations
sentences.chinese: 紧张谈判的一天

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time

name: construction
trans: n. 建造，建设；建筑业建造物，建筑物解释，意思结构，句法关系形容词:constructional

sentences.english: a road construction project
sentences.chinese: 道路修建计划

sentences.english: construction workers
sentences.chinese: 建筑工人

detailed_translations.english: the process of building things such as houses, bridges, roads etc

name: liable
trans: adj. 有法律责任的, 有义务的易患…的, 易受…之害的有做某事的倾向

sentences.english: The car is liable to overheat on long trips.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车跑长途容易过热。

detailed_translations.english: likely to be affected by a particular kind of problem, illness etc

name: consult
trans: 时态:consulted, consulting, consults名 词:consulter

sentences.english: If symptoms persist, consult a doctor without delay.
sentences.chinese: 如果症状持续的话，马上咨询医生。

sentences.english: Have you consulted a dictionary?
sentences.chinese: 你查过词典了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to ask for information or advice from someone because it is their job to know something

sentences.english: Nutrition and exercise are essential to fitness and health.
sentences.chinese: 营养和运动是保持健康所必不可少的。

sentences.english: a nutrition expert
sentences.chinese: 营养专家

detailed_translations.english: the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth

name: consultant
trans: n. 顾问高级顾问医生, 会诊医生

sentences.english: a management consultant
sentences.chinese: 管理顾问

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to give advice on a particular subject

name: organ
trans: n. 风琴；器官；机构；管风琴；嗓音

sentences.english: the liver, heart, and other internal organs
sentences.chinese: 肝脏、心脏及其他内脏器官

sentences.english: loss of blood flow to his vital organs
sentences.chinese: 他的生命器官供血不足

sentences.english: Extra doses of the hormone caused the animals’ reproductive organs to develop sooner than usual.
sentences.chinese: 额外使用激素使得这些动物的生殖器官比正常情况下发育得更快。

sentences.english: In Arizona, 480 people are waiting for organ transplants.
sentences.chinese: 亚利桑那州有480人在等待器官移植。

sentences.english: dying people who have agreed to be organ donors
sentences.chinese: 愿意捐献器官的垂死的病人

detailed_translations.english: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose

name: consume
trans: vt. 消耗, 消费, 耗尽大吃, 大喝烧毁, 毁灭

sentences.english: Some of the most efficient refrigerators consume 70 percent less electricity than traditional models.
sentences.chinese: 一些能效最高的冰箱比传统型号少消耗70%的电。

detailed_translations.english: To consume an amount of fuel, energy, or time means to use it up
to use time, energy, goods etc

sentences.english: the pharmaceutical industry
sentences.chinese: 制药业

sentences.english: pharmaceutical products
sentences.chinese: 药物

sentences.english: Antibiotics were of no use, neither were other pharmaceuticals.
sentences.chinese: 抗生素没有用，其他药物也没有用。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the production of drugs and medicines
Pharmaceuticals are medicines

name: purification
trans: n. 洗净，净化提纯，精炼涤罪，洗罪；斋戒(犹太妇女按教规在月经后行的)洁净礼

sentences.english: I saw this policy of “purification” up close.
sentences.chinese: 我目睹的了“净化”政策的整个过程。

sentences.english: The country has already produced nanotechnology products for export in areas including food packaging, water purification and herbal medicine.
sentences.chinese: 该国已经生产了供出口的纳米技术产品，其领域包括食品包装、水净化以及草药。

sentences.english: The fact that the yoga is performed in the nude is significant because in the nude status, the toxins in the body find an outlet leading to purification of body and soul.
sentences.chinese: 这种瑜伽裸体进行，这一事实非常重要，因为在裸体的状态中，身体中的“毒素”会找到一个出口而后引向肉体与灵魂的净化。

name: contain
trans: vt. 包含；容纳控制，抑制

sentences.english: The thieves stole a purse containing bank-notes.
sentences.chinese: 小偷们偷到了一个里面有钞票的钱包。

sentences.english: The museum contains a number of original artworks.
sentences.chinese: 这家博物馆藏有一些原创艺术品。

detailed_translations.english: if something such as a bag, box, or place contains something, that thing is inside it

name: side
trans: n. 面；侧面；边方面一方，一边
adj. 侧面的，边的枝节的，次要的

sentences.english: Fuel is cheaper on the French side of the border.
sentences.chinese: 燃料在边境那边的法国要便宜些。

sentences.english: A man stood watching me from the other side of the road.
sentences.chinese: 有个男人站在马路的对面看着我。

sentences.english: His friends and family were all on the other side of the world.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友和家人都在地球的另一边。

sentences.english: The restaurant was empty apart from another couple on the far side of the room (= the area that is furthest away from you ) .
sentences.chinese: 饭店里空空的，只有最那边还有一对夫妇。

sentences.english: He is in charge of the civilian side of the UN mission.
sentences.chinese: 他在联合国使团中负责平民方面的事务。

sentences.english: Frank sided with David against their mother.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰克站在戴维一边反对妈妈。

sentences.english: Hannah slipped out through a side exit.
sentences.chinese: 汉娜从一个侧门溜了出去。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two areas that are on the left or the right of an imaginary line, or on the left or the right of a border, wall, river etc
to support or argue against a person or group in a quarrel, fight etc
in or on the side of something

name: container
trans: n. 容器集装箱, 货柜

sentences.english: ice cream in plastic containers
sentences.chinese: 塑料容器里的冰激凌

sentences.english: a container ship
sentences.chinese: 集装箱船

detailed_translations.english: something such as a box or bowl that you use to keep things in

name: surgery
trans: n. 外科；外科手术；手术室；诊疗室

sentences.english: major/minor surgery
sentences.chinese: 大 / 小手术

detailed_translations.english: medical treatment of injuries or diseases that involves cutting open a person's body and often removing or replacing some parts; the branch of medicine connected with this treatment

name: continual
trans: adj. 不间断的, 不停的多次重复的, 频繁的副 词:continually

sentences.english: five weeks of continual rain
sentences.chinese: 持续了五个星期的降雨

sentences.english: the Japanese business philosophy of continual improvement
sentences.chinese: 日本人精益求精的经营哲学

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a long time without stopping

name: trauma
trans: n. 外伤；创伤（由心理创伤造成精神上的异常）形容词:traumatic

sentences.english: traumas such as death or divorce
sentences.chinese: 死亡、离婚等的巨大痛苦

detailed_translations.english: an unpleasant and upsetting experience that affects you for a long time

name: continuation
trans: n. 继续,连续,持续延长部分

sentences.english: It's the coalition forces who are to blame for the continuation of the war.
sentences.chinese: 是联军应对战争的持续负责。

detailed_translations.chinese: 继续；续集；延长；附加部分；扩建物
detailed_translations.english: something that continues or follows something else that has happened before, without a stop or change

sentences.english: She waived her right to a lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 她放弃了请律师的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to state officially that a right, rule etc can be ignored

name: continue
trans: vi. 仍旧，连续；继续，延续
vt. 继续说…；使…继续；使…延长
时态:continued, continuing, continues 缩 写:cont

sentences.english: He will be continuing his education in the US.
sentences.chinese: 他将在美国继续求学。

sentences.english: 英文例句: I felt too sick to continue.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉很难受，无法继续下去了。

sentences.english: 英文例句:The road continues northwards to the border.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 这条路往北一直延伸到边境。

detailed_translations.english: to not stop happening, existing, or doing something

name: appliance
trans: n. 器具, 器械, 装置

sentences.english: The device most often used to do this is a load balancer, which is an appliance that accepts requests from the outside world and hands them off to the next available application server.
sentences.chinese: 进行这一操作最常用的设备是一个负载均衡器，这是一个从外部接收请求并将它们移交给下一个可用应用程序服务器的装置。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment, especially electrical equipment, such as a  cooker  or  washing machine  , used in people’s homes

name: contribute
trans: vt. & vi. 捐献, 捐助, 贡献出撰稿, 投稿

sentences.english: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.chinese: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.english: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

detailed_translations.english: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose

sentences.english: Burglars broke into their home.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼闯进了他们家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who goes into houses, shops etc to steal things

name: contribution
trans: n. 捐助物, 贡献捐款

sentences.english: All the money has been raised by voluntary contribution.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些钱都是靠自愿捐献筹集的。

detailed_translations.english: something that you give or do in order to help something be successful

name: community
trans: n. 社区, 社会, 团体大众, 公众共有, 共享

sentences.english: The new arts centre will serve the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 这座新的艺术中心将为整个社区服务。

sentences.english: the Polish community in London
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦的波兰侨民团体

detailed_translations.english: the people who live in the same area, town etc

name: control
trans: vt. 控制, 抑制, 支配管理, 操纵
n. 控制, 支配, 管理管理手段
时态:controlled, controlling, controls名 词:controllability

sentences.english: Police had to be called in to control the crowds.
sentences.chinese: 只好调来警察控制人群。

sentences.english: He controlled the urge to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他克制住笑的冲动。

sentences.english: The disease robs you of muscle control.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病会让你丧失肌肉控制力。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something do what you want, or make something happen in the way that you want
the ability or power to make someone or something do what you want or make something happen in the way you want

sentences.english: an electronics engineer
sentences.chinese: 电子工程师

detailed_translations.english: the study or industry of making equipment, such as computers and televisions, that work electronically

name: fire
trans: n. 火；火灾；炉火；热情；炮火；激情；磨难
vt. 解雇；点燃；烧制；使发光；开除；放枪；激动
vi. 射击；激动；烧火；开枪；着火
时态:fired, firing, fires名 词:firer

sentences.english: The warehouse was completely destroyed by fire.
sentences.chinese: 仓库全给烧毁了。

sentences.english: Thirty people died in a fire in downtown Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 30人死于芝加哥市中心的一场火灾。

sentences.english: Police think that the fire was started deliberately.
sentences.chinese: 警方认为有人故意纵火。

sentences.english: Rioters set fire to a whole row of stores (= made them start burning ) .
sentences.chinese: 暴徒纵火焚烧了一整排商店。

sentences.english: Soldiers fired on the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 士兵朝人群开枪。

detailed_translations.english: uncontrolled flames, light, and heat that destroy and damage things
to shoot bullets or bombs

name: convenient
trans: adj. 方便的, 便利的, 合适的附近的, 近便的副 词:conveniently

sentences.english: Mail-order catalogs are a convenient way to shop.
sentences.chinese: 使用邮购目录是一种方便的购物方式。

sentences.english: My secretary will call you to arrange a convenient time to meet.
sentences.chinese: 我的秘书会打电话给你安排一个方便的时间见面。

sentences.english: restaurants convenient for shops and theatres
sentences.chinese: 靠近商店和剧院的餐厅

detailed_translations.english: useful to you because it saves you time, or does not spoil your plans or cause you problems

sentences.english: I helped him choose the furniture for his house.
sentences.chinese: 我帮他挑选房子里用的家具。

sentences.english: I can’t think of a single piece of furniture in my house that I bought new.
sentences.chinese: 我想不出家里有哪件家具是新买的。

sentences.english: office furniture
sentences.chinese: 办公室家具

detailed_translations.english: large objects such as chairs, tables, beds, and cupboards

name: conveniently
trans: v. 方便地，便利地；合宜地

sentences.english: Conveniently, her parents are often willing to babysit.
sentences.chinese: 方便的是，她父母通常都愿意临时照看一下小孩。

sentences.english: At that time, ice cream couldn’t be conveniently bought in a store.
sentences.chinese: 那时候冰激凌还无法很方便地在商店里买到。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is useful to you because it saves you time or does not spoil your plans or cause you problems

sentences.english: Can you take out the garbage when you go?
sentences.chinese: 你走的时候把垃圾带出去好吗？

detailed_translations.english: waste material, such as paper, empty containers, and food thrown away

sentences.english: His landlord doubled the rent.
sentences.chinese: 他的房东把房租提高了一倍。

detailed_translations.english: a man who rents a room, building, or piece of land to someone

name: convincing
trans: adj. 令人相信的;有说服力的

sentences.english: convincing evidence of his guilt
sentences.chinese: 证明他有罪的有力证据

detailed_translations.english: making you believe that something is true or right

name: laundry
trans: n. 洗衣店，洗衣房洗好的衣服；待洗的衣服

sentences.english: She did the laundry (= washed the clothes etc ) and hung it out to dry.
sentences.chinese: 她洗了衣服，然后挂出去晾干。

sentences.english: a pile of dirty laundry
sentences.chinese: 一堆待洗的脏衣服

detailed_translations.english: clothes, sheets etc that need to be washed or have just been washed

name: lease
trans: n. 租约；租期；租赁物；租赁权

sentences.english: The landlord refused to renew his lease.
sentences.chinese: 房东拒绝和他续签租约。

sentences.english: The 99-year lease expired in 1999.
sentences.chinese: 99年期的租约于1999年到期。

sentences.english: Do you understand all the terms of the lease?
sentences.chinese: 租约条款你都理解吗？

detailed_translations.english: a legal agreement which allows you to use a building, car etc for a period of time, in return for rent

detailed_translations.chinese: 出租； 租得， 租有
detailed_translations.english: to use a building, car etc under a lease

sentences.english: The ten young people sleep between two hard, narrow beds and one large mattress on the floor with no privacy at all.
sentences.chinese: 十个年轻人就睡在两张窄小的硬板床和地板上的一张大床垫上，没有任何隐私可言。

sentences.english: If someone pokes fun at your mattress on the floor, or teases you about your empty cabinets, smile and take it in stride.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人取笑你放在地板上的床垫，或揶揄你空空的橱柜，请面带微笑从容应对此事。

sentences.english: She laid a spring mattress under the sheet.
sentences.chinese: 她在床单下面铺了一个弹簧床垫。

detailed_translations.english: the soft part of a bed that you lie on

name: cost
trans: n. 价格，成本，费用代价，损失
vt. 付出(代价)，失去估价

COSTabbr. Committee for Overseas Science and Technology 海外科学技术委员会Committee on Science and Technology 科学技术委员会Continental Offshore Stratigraphic Test 大陆近海地层学试验Cooperation in Science and Technology 科学技术合作

sentences.english: I offered to pay the cost of the taxi.
sentences.chinese: 我提出支付出租车费。

sentences.english: Insurance to cover the cost of a funeral is possible.
sentences.chinese: 可以用保险支付葬礼费用。

sentences.english: This doesn’t include the cost of repairing the damage.
sentences.chinese: 这不包括修理破损的费用。

sentences.english: the terrible cost of the war in death and suffering
sentences.chinese: 这场战争造成的死亡与苦难的惨重代价

sentences.english: low cost housing
sentences.chinese: 低成本住宅

sentences.english: the high cost of production
sentences.chinese: 很高的生产成本

sentences.english: A cassette/radio is included at no extra cost .
sentences.chinese: 附送一台卡式收录机。

sentences.english: The funds will just cover the museum’s running costs .
sentences.chinese: 这些资金只够支付博物馆的运转费用。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you have to pay in order to buy, do, or produce something

name: mortgage
trans: n. 抵押借款抵押债款的利息

sentences.english: Your building society or bank will help arrange a mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你加入的购房互助协会或银行将会给你安排抵押贷款。

sentences.english: They’ve taken out a 30 year mortgage (= they will pay for their house over a period of 30 years ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们办理了一笔30年期的抵押贷款。

sentences.english: We decided to use Fred’s redundancy money to pay off the mortgage (= pay back all the money we borrowed for a mortgage ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定用弗雷德的遣散费来偿清抵押贷款。

sentences.english: Mortgage rates are set to rise again in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款利率到春季肯定还要上涨。

sentences.english: She was having trouble meeting her mortgage payments .
sentences.chinese: 她还抵押贷款有困难。

detailed_translations.english: a legal arrangement by which you borrow money from a bank or similar organization in order to buy a house, and pay back the money over a period of years

if you mortgage your home, land, or property, you borrow money, usually from a bank, and if you cannot pay back the money within a particular period of time, the bank has the right to sell your property in order to get the money you owe it

name: counter
trans: n. 柜台, 柜台式长桌计数器
vt. & vi. 对抗, 反驳ad
v. 反方向地, 对立地

sentences.english: He wondered if the girl behind the counter recognised him.
sentences.chinese: 他在想柜台后面的那个女孩是否认出了他。

sentences.english: Set the video counter to zero before you press play.
sentences.chinese: 在按播放键之前，把录像机上的计数器调到零。

detailed_translations.english: the place where you pay or are served in a shop, bank, restaurant etc

name: ornament
trans: n. 装饰；装饰物；教堂用品
时态:ornamented, ornamenting, ornaments名 词:ornamenter

sentences.english: a shelf covered with books and ornaments
sentences.chinese: 摆满书籍和装饰品的架子

sentences.english: a cabinet in which she kept her collection of china ornaments
sentences.chinese: 她放置瓷器摆设收藏品的柜子

detailed_translations.chinese: 装饰品，点缀品；装饰，点缀
detailed_translations.english: a small object that you keep in your house because it is beautiful rather than useful

detailed_translations.chinese: 装饰， 点缀， 美化

name: plumbing
trans: n. 铅工业；铅管品制造
v. 探究；垂直悬挂；用铅锤测量；灌铅以增重（plumb的现在分词）

name: possession
trans: n. 占有, 持有, 拥有个人财产, 私人财物领地, 属地, 殖民地

sentences.english: That information is not in our possession.
sentences.chinese: 那则信息不归我们所有。

sentences.english: How did the painting come into your possession (= how did you get it ) ?
sentences.chinese: 这幅画是怎么到你手上的？

sentences.english: The finance company now has possession of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这家金融公司目前拥有这所房子。

sentences.english: We didn’t take possession of (= get and start using ) the car until a few days after the auction.
sentences.chinese: 拍卖会过后几天我们才正式拿到那辆车。

detailed_translations.english: if something is in your possession, you own it, or you have obtained it from somewhere

name: real
trans: adj. 真实的；实在的；实际的ad
n. 现实；实数名 词:realness

sentences.english: She had never seen a real live elephant before.
sentences.chinese: 她以前从未见过活生生的大象。

sentences.english: a coat made of real fur
sentences.chinese: 真皮大衣

sentences.english: Things don’t happen quite that easily in real life.
sentences.chinese: 现实生活中不会动不动就有这样的事情发生。

detailed_translations.english: something that is real is actually what it seems to be and not false or artificial

name: renovate
trans: v. 修复；翻新；重新粉刷；整修（尤指建筑物）

sentences.english: The hotel has been renovated and redecorated.
sentences.chinese: 酒店已经翻新，并重新装饰。

detailed_translations.english: to repair a building or old furniture so that it is in good condition again

sentences.english: a rural setting
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境

sentences.english: rural bus routes
sentences.chinese: 乡村公共汽车路线

detailed_translations.english: happening in or relating to the countryside, not the city

name: credentials
trans: n. 资格证书; 国书(任何证明人的能力、资格等的)证书; 资格

sentences.english: The commissioner presented his credentials to the State Department.
sentences.chinese: 该委员向国务院递交了他的任职资格证书。

detailed_translations.chinese: [管理] 证书；文凭；信任状（credential的复数）
detailed_translations.english: a letter or other document which proves your good character or your right to have a particular position

detailed_translations.chinese: 得到信用；授…以证书（credential的三单形式）

sentences.english: a London suburb
sentences.chinese: 一个伦敦郊区

sentences.english: a kid from the suburbs
sentences.chinese: 来自郊区的小孩子

detailed_translations.chinese: 郊区， 郊外， 近郊
detailed_translations.english: an area where people live which is away from the centre of a town or city

name: urban
trans: adj. 城市的；住在都市的

sentences.english: unemployment in urban areas
sentences.chinese: 城市地区的失业状况

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population
sentences.chinese: 城市人口中的贫困群体

detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

sentences.english: The most important criterion for entry is that applicants must design and make their own work.
sentences.chinese: 参加的最重要标准就是申请人必须设计并制作自己的作品。

detailed_translations.english: A criterion is a factor on which you judge or decide something

name: balcony
trans: n. 阳台；包厢；戏院楼厅

sentences.english: Has your flat got a balcony?
sentences.chinese: 你的公寓有阳台吗？

detailed_translations.english: a structure that you can stand on, that is attached to the outside wall of a building, above ground level

name: critical
trans: adj. 批评的，爱挑剔的；决定性的；危险的；临界的；鉴定的；评论的副 词:critically

sentences.english: He made some highly critical remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他发表了一些严厉的批判性言论。

detailed_translations.english: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

name: chore
trans: n. 家庭杂务；日常的零星事务；讨厌的或累人的工作

sentences.english: everyday chores like shopping and housework
sentences.chinese: 购物和做家务之类的日常琐事

sentences.english: We share the domestic chores.
sentences.chinese: 我们分担家务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 家庭杂务；日常的零星事务；讨厌的或累人的工作
detailed_translations.english: a small job that you have to do regularly, especially work that you do to keep a house clean

name: down
trans: n. 软毛，绒毛；开阔的高地

sentences.english: David bent down to tie his shoelace.
sentences.chinese: 戴维弯腰系鞋带。

sentences.english: Get down off the table.
sentences.chinese: 从桌子上下来。

sentences.english: Tears were streaming down my face.
sentences.chinese: 我泪流满面。

sentences.english: The sun was going down and it would soon be dark.
sentences.chinese: 夕阳西下，天很快就要黑了。

sentences.english: They came running down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们跑下楼来。

sentences.english: She stood on a balcony looking down into the courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 她站在阳台上朝下面的院子望去。

sentences.english: Glancing down the list of runners, I noticed a familiar name.
sentences.chinese: 我往下扫了一眼赛跑选手的名单，注意到了一个熟悉的名字。

sentences.english: Her hair came down to her waist.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发一直垂到腰际。

sentences.english: Ken fell asleep face down (= with his face towards the ground ) on the couch.
sentences.chinese: 肯趴在长沙发上睡着了。

sentences.english: We heard the sound of laughter down below.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到下面有笑声。

sentences.english: The bathroom is down those stairs.
sentences.chinese: 浴室在那段楼梯下面。

detailed_translations.english: to or towards a lower place or position

name: crowd
trans: n. 人群听众，观众一群，一批；一堆

sentences.english: A vast crowd gathered in the main square.
sentences.chinese: 主广场上聚集了一大群人。

sentences.english: She mingled with the crowd of guests, exchanging greetings.
sentences.chinese: 她穿梭在宾客中间和他们打招呼。

sentences.english: Saturday’s game was watched by a capacity crowd (= the maximum number of people that a sports ground etc can hold ) .
sentences.chinese: 星期六的比赛座无虚席。

sentences.english: Troops fired tear gas and shots to disperse a crowd of 15,000 demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 军队发射催泪弹并开枪来驱散15,000名示威群众。

sentences.english: I didn’t know him; he wasn’t one of the usual crowd.
sentences.chinese: 我不认识他，他不是平时那一群人里的。

sentences.english: He wanted to go unnoticed, to be one of the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他想默默无闻地做个普通人。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of people who have gathered together to do something, for example to watch something or protest about something

sentences.english: a home furnishings store
sentences.chinese: 家居用品店

detailed_translations.chinese: 家具；供应；穿戴用品（furnishing的复数）
detailed_translations.english: the furniture and other things, such as curtains, in a room

sentences.english: a crowded room
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的房间

sentences.english: a crowded street
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的街道

sentences.english: The train was very crowded, and we had to stand.
sentences.chinese: 火车很挤，我们只好站着。

detailed_translations.english: too full of people or things

name: garage
trans: n. 车库汽车修理站；加油站

sentences.english: I’ll just go and put the car in the garage.
sentences.chinese: 我把车停到车库去。

sentences.english: an automatic garage door
sentences.chinese: 车库自动门

detailed_translations.english: a building for keeping a car in, usually next to or attached to a house

name: crucial
trans: adj. 决定性的；重要的；定局的；决断的副 词:crucially

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

sentences.english: She has a huge amount of Victorian kitchenware.
sentences.chinese: 她拥有维多利亚时代的大量厨房用具。

detailed_translations.english: pots, pans, and other things used for cooking

sentences.english: I spent all morning mowing the lawn (= cutting the grass ).
sentences.chinese: 我整个上午都在修剪草坪。

sentences.english: a carefully tended lawn
sentences.chinese: 受到细心呵护的草坪

detailed_translations.english: an area of ground in a garden or park that is covered with short grass

name: current
trans: adj. 现在的；最近的；草写的；流通的，通用的
n. 趋势；涌流；（水，气，电）流副 词:currently

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

sentences.english: We obtained a loan from the government.
sentences.chinese: 我们得了一笔政府贷款。

sentences.english: If you ask him for a loan, he'll come through.
sentences.chinese: 如果你向他贷款，他会满足你的要求的。

sentences.english: The company won't keep going unless we can get some loan.
sentences.chinese: 除非我们能搞到贷款，否则公司就维持不下去了。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you borrow from a bank etc

sentences.english: She was stopped at customs and questioned.
sentences.chinese: 她在海关被叫住接受问话。

sentences.english: It took ages to clear customs (= be allowed through customs ) but then we were out of the airport quite quickly.
sentences.chinese: 过海关花了很长时间，不过出机场倒是很快。

sentences.english: You won’t be able to take that through customs.
sentences.chinese: 你带着那东西过不了海关的。

detailed_translations.english: the place where your bags are checked for illegal goods when you go into a country

name: messy
trans: adj. 肮脏的，污秽的；凌乱的，散乱的；麻烦的比较级:messier, messiest副 词:messily

sentences.english: a messy room
sentences.chinese: 凌乱的房间

sentences.chinese: 对不起，这地方又脏又乱，我一直没时间打扫。

detailed_translations.english: dirty or untidy

trans: n. 地区;某地区的人;与某处邻近的地区

sentences.english: Iterates may be categorized into stable and unstable sets depending on whether a neighborhood under iteration converges or diverges. Some move toward stability, others away.
sentences.chinese: 根据一个受迭代影响的社区是聚合还是发散，迭代可以被归类到稳定和不稳定集。有些转向稳定，有些转离。

name: playground
trans: n. 操场；游乐场，娱乐场

sentences.english: children shouting and running in the playground
sentences.chinese: 在操场上叫嚷奔跑的孩子们

detailed_translations.english: an area for children to play, especially at a school or in a park, that often has special equipment for climbing on, riding on etc

sentences.english: He was standing on the porch, waving as we drove away.
sentences.chinese: 我们开车离开的时候，他站在走廊上向我们挥手。

detailed_translations.english: an entrance covered by a roof outside the front door of a house or church

trans: n. 循环；周期；整套；自行车；一段时间
vi. 骑自行车；循环；轮转
时态:cycled, cycling, cycles名 词:cycler

sentences.english: a woman’s menstrual cycle
sentences.chinese: 女性的月经周期

detailed_translations.chinese: 自行车、 摩托车； 循环
detailed_translations.english: a number of related events that happen again and again in the same order

name: property
trans: n. 财产；性质，性能；所有权形容词:propertyless

sentences.english: The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests’ personal property .
sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.english: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

detailed_translations.english: the thing or things that someone owns

name: D
trans: 直接指出的;直接证明的;直证的;指示的

name: relocate
trans: vi. 迁移新址；重新安置
时态:relocated, relocating, relocates名 词:relocation

sentences.english: If the company was to relocate, most employees would move.
sentences.chinese: 如果公司要迁移，大多数员工得搬家。

detailed_translations.english: if a person or business relocates, or if they are relocated, they move to a different place

name: daily
trans: n. 日报；[美口]朝来夜去的女佣ad

sentences.english: daily flights to Miami
sentences.chinese: 每日飞往迈阿密的航班

sentences.english: China Daily receives dispatches from all parts of the world.
sentences.chinese: 《中国日报》收到世界各地发来的电讯。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done every day
a newspaper that is printed and sold every day, or every day except Sunday

name: residence
trans: n. 住处; 住宅; 公馆居住; 居留期间

sentences.english: Rome was his main place of residence.
sentences.chinese: 罗马是他的主要居住地。

sentences.english: the ambassador’s official residence
sentences.chinese: 大使官邸

detailed_translations.english: the state of living in a place

name: damage
trans: vt. & vi. 损害, 毁坏, 加害于
n. 损失, 损害, 损毁损害赔偿金

sentences.english: insects that damage crops
sentences.chinese: 破坏庄稼的昆虫

sentences.english: There may be permanent brain damage.
sentences.chinese: 可能有永久性脑损伤。

detailed_translations.english: to cause physical harm to something or to part of someone’s body
physical harm that is done to something or to a part of someone’s body, so that it is broken or injured

sentences.english: the storage of highly radioactive material
sentences.chinese: 高放射性材料的存放

sentences.english: storage costs

detailed_translations.english: the process of keeping or putting something in a special place while it is not being used

name: tenant
trans: n. 房客, 佃户, 承租人〈律〉占用者, 占有者

sentences.english: The desk was left by the previous tenant.
sentences.chinese: 书桌是上一个房客留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a house, room etc and pays rent to the person who owns it

name: deal
trans: vt. 发牌；处理；给予；分配
vi. 处理；做生意；对待；讨论
n. 交易；份量；待遇；（美）政策DEALabbr. Decision Evaluation And Logic 判定鉴定与逻辑

sentences.english: The prime minister promised farmers a new deal (= a new and fairer system ) .
sentences.chinese: 首相向农民保证推行一项新政策。

detailed_translations.english: treatment of a particular type that is given or received

name: utility
trans: n. 效用；实用；功用；公共设施
adj. 有多种用途的；通用的；实用的

sentences.english: Does your rent include utilities?
sentences.chinese: 你的房租包括公用事业费吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 公用事业〔如煤气、电力等〕
detailed_translations.english: a service such as gas or electricity provided for people to use

name: affection
trans: n. 感情；喜爱，关爱；爱慕之情；影响形容词:affectional

sentences.english: She looked back on those days with affection .
sentences.chinese: 她深情地回顾那些日子。

sentences.english: Their father never showed them much affection .
sentences.chinese: 他们的父亲对他们从来没有表现出多少慈爱。

sentences.english: Anne had two men trying to win her affections.
sentences.chinese: 安妮有两个男人追求。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of liking or loving sb/sth very much and caring about them

name: anticipate
trans: vt. 先于…行动预感, 期望
时态:anticipated, anticipating, anticipates名 词:anticipator

sentences.english: Sales are better than anticipated.
sentences.chinese: 销量比预期要好。

sentences.english: A good speaker is able to anticipate an audience’s needs and concerns.
sentences.chinese: 好的演讲者能够预先考虑到听众需要什么、关注什么。

sentences.english: Daniel was eagerly anticipating her arrival.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔热切地期待着她的到来。

detailed_translations.english: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it

name: decision
trans: n. 决定, 决心, 判断果断, 坚决决议, 结果

sentences.english: Do you ever wonder if you made the right decision?
sentences.chinese: 你怀疑过自己所作的决定是否正确吗？

sentences.english: The judges’ decision is final (= it will not be changed ).
sentences.chinese: 法官的裁决是最终判决。

sentences.english: the ability to act with speed and decision
sentences.chinese: 处事迅速果断的能力

detailed_translations.english: a choice or judgment that you make after a period of discussion or thought

name: brag
trans: vt. & vi. 自夸, 吹嘘
时态:bragged, bragging, brags名 词:bragger

sentences.english: Do not brag or bluff.
sentences.chinese: 不要自夸和虚张声势。

sentences.english: It is not in good form to brag of your learning.
sentences.chinese: 吹嘘自己的学识是欠妥的。

sentences.english: These are the people that have every right to brag and maybe be a bit arrogant, yet they remain humble.
sentences.chinese: 这些人有理由吹嘘自己的成功，甚至理应有点自傲，但是他们仍然保持着低调的作风。

detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about what you have done, what you own etc – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: The bathroom is decorated in green and yellow.
sentences.chinese: 浴室里是用绿色和黄色装潢的。

sentences.english: We plan to spend the weekend decorating.
sentences.chinese: 我们计划用这个周末来装修。

detailed_translations.english: to paint the inside of a room, put special paper on the walls etc

name: delighted
trans: adj. 喜欢的, 高兴的副 词:delightedly

sentences.english: Her screams of delighted laughter filled the air.
sentences.chinese: 她喜悦的尖叫声在空中荡漾。

detailed_translations.english: very pleased and happy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…兴高采烈；感到快乐（delight的过去分词）

name: decrease
trans: 时态:decreased, decreasing, decreases副 词:decreasingly

sentences.english: The number of people who have the disease has decreased significantly in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，这种病的患者人数明显下降。

sentences.english: They want to decrease their reliance on oil.
sentences.chinese: 他们想减少对石油的依赖。

sentences.english: There has been a steady decrease of temperature.
sentences.chinese: 气温在持续下降。

detailed_translations.english: to become less or go down to a lower level, or to make something do this
the process of becoming less, or the amount by which something becomes less

sentences.english: The two men detested each other.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人互相厌恶。

detailed_translations.english: to hate something or someone very much

name: dedicate
trans: 时态:dedicated, dedicating, dedicates名 词:dedicator

sentences.english: The actress now dedicates herself to children’s charity work.
sentences.chinese: 这名女演员现在致力于儿童慈善工作。

detailed_translations.english: to give all your attention and effort to one particular thing

name: disgust
trans: n. 反感, 厌恶, 嫌恶

sentences.english: He reached into the bin with a look of disgust on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他把手伸进垃圾箱，脸上带着厌恶的表情。

sentences.english: He disgusted many with his boorish behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他以其粗鲁的行为使许多人感到厌恶。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of dislike, annoyance, or disapproval
To disgust someone means to make them feel a strong sense of dislike and disapproval

sentences.english: The company deducted this payment from his compensation.
sentences.chinese: 公司从他的补偿金中扣除了这笔款项。

detailed_translations.english: to take away an amount or part from a total

name: distress
trans: n. 悲痛, 痛苦, 忧伤, 苦恼贫困, 窘迫危险, 困难, 危难
vt. 使痛苦, 使忧伤

sentences.english: The dream had distressed her greatly.
sentences.chinese: 这场梦使她深感不安。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very upset

name: defect
trans: n. 缺点，缺陷；不足之处
时态:defected, defecting, defects名 词:defection

sentences.english: All the cars are tested for defects before they leave the factory.
sentences.chinese: 所有汽车在出厂前都经过品质检验。

sentences.english: a genetic defect
sentences.chinese: 遗传缺陷

name: enthusiastic
trans: adj. 满腔热情的，热心的；极感兴趣的副 词:enthusiastically

sentences.english: an enthusiastic supporter of reform
sentences.chinese: 改革的热心支持者

detailed_translations.english: feeling or showing a lot of interest and excitement about something

name: esteem
trans: vt. 认为；尊敬；考虑；估价

sentences.english: Peden was greatly esteemed by the people of Ayrshire.
sentences.chinese: 佩登深受艾尔郡人的尊敬。

sentences.english: He was esteemed as a literary wit.
sentences.chinese: 他被尊为文学才子。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and admire someone or something

name: definite
trans: adj. 明确的, 确切的一定的, 肯定的副 词:definitely

sentences.english: It’s impossible for me to give you a definite answer.
sentences.chinese: 我不可能给你明确的答复。

sentences.english: We need to record sufficient data to enable definite conclusions to be reached.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要记录足够的数据，才能得出明确的结论。

sentences.english: He’d shown definite signs of resigning himself to the situation.
sentences.chinese: 他明显表现出安于这种状况的样子。

sentences.english: Fix a definite date for the delivery of your computer.
sentences.chinese: 请为你的电脑定个确切的交货日期。

trans: n. 魅力；有魅力的东西迷恋，陶醉

sentences.chinese: 吸引力就在于这神秘感——不知道盒子里是什么东西。

name: definitely
trans: v. 明确地, 确切地一定地, 肯定地

sentences.english: ‘Do you reckon Margot will be there?’ ‘ Definitely not .’
sentences.chinese: “你估计玛戈会在那里吗？” “肯定不会。”

sentences.english: The hotel fitness centre is definitely worth a visit.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店的健身中心绝对值得一去。

sentences.english: I definitely need a holiday.
sentences.chinese: 我太需要休假了。

name: gloomy
trans: adj. 黑暗的；沮丧的；阴郁的比较级:gloomier, gloomiest副 词:gloomily

sentences.english: The report paints a gloomy picture of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报告描绘了一幅惨淡的经济现状。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忧郁的， 沮丧的； 令人沮丧的； 昏暗的， 阴沉的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel that things will not improve

name: degree
trans: n. 程度，等级；度；学位；阶层

sentences.chinese: 报纸重宣传轻资讯的程度各不相同。

detailed_translations.english: the level or amount of something

name: impartial
trans: adj. 不偏不倚的；公平的，公正的名 词:impartiality

sentences.english: We offer impartial advice on tax and insurance.
sentences.chinese: 我们就税收和保险问题提供公充的建议。

sentences.english: an impartial inquiry into the deaths
sentences.chinese: 对死亡事件的公正调查

sentences.english: an impartial observer
sentences.chinese: 公正的观察员

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平的，公正的；不偏不倚的
detailed_translations.english: not involved in a particular situation, and therefore able to give a fair opinion or piece of advice

name: impulsive
trans: adj. (指人或人的行为)冲动的,易冲动的ad

sentences.english: Rosa was impulsive and sometimes regretted things she’d done.
sentences.chinese: 罗莎性情鲁莽，有时会为做过的事感到后悔。

sentences.english: In a burst of impulsive generosity, I offered to pay.
sentences.chinese: 因一时慷慨，我主动提出付款。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冲动的；受感情驱使的；任性的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is impulsive does things without considering the possible dangers or problems first

sentences.english: The kids were screaming with delight.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在高兴地尖叫。

sentences.english: He is delighting audiences with his wit and humour.
sentences.chinese: 他在用自己的智慧和幽默娱乐观众。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great pleasure and satisfaction
to give someone great satisfaction and enjoyment

name: mad
trans: adj. 疯了的，发疯的，神经错乱的恼火的，发怒的狂热的；着迷的愚蠢的MADabbr. machine analysis display 机器分析显示比较级:madder，maddest形容词:maddish

sentences.english: He can’t possibly get that finished in time. He must be mad !
sentences.chinese: 他不可能按时完成的。他一定是疯了！

sentences.english: I’d go mad (= start to feel crazy ) if I was stuck at home all day.
sentences.chinese: 如果我整天困在家里我会发疯的。

sentences.english: He’s been driving me mad !
sentences.chinese: 他真让我受不了！

sentences.english: You’ve agreed to marry him! Are you mad?
sentences.chinese: 你已经同意跟他结婚了！你疯了吗？

sentences.english: Surely no one would be mad enough to fly in this weather?
sentences.chinese: 肯定没有人会傻到在这样的天气条件下飞行吧？

sentences.english: My friends all think I’m stark raving mad (= completely crazy ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友都认为我是彻底疯了。

sentences.english: It’s enough to send you barking mad (= completely crazy ) .
sentences.chinese: 这足以让你发狂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疯狂的；发疯的；愚蠢的；着迷的
detailed_translations.english: crazy or very silly

name: objective
trans: adj. 客观的; 不带偏见的副 词:objectively

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: deliver
trans: vt. 发表；递送；释放；给予（打击）；交付；给…接生
vi. 传送；投递；履行；实现
时态:delivered, delivering, delivers名 词:deliverability

sentences.english: The morning mail has just been delivered.
sentences.chinese: 早晨的邮件刚送到。

sentences.english: Do you deliver on Saturdays?
sentences.chinese: 星期六你们送货吗？

sentences.english: I’m having some flowers delivered for her birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我在安排人给她送花祝贺生日。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, letters, packages etc to a particular place or person

name: panic
trans: adj. 恐慌的；没有理由的
vi. 十分惊慌Panic潘神的,牧人之神的

sentences.english: Her face distorted in panic.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸因恐慌而变相了。

sentences.english: The panic-stricken fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 惊慌的人群向四面八方逃去。

sentences.english: They ascribed courage to me for something I did out of sheer panic.
sentences.chinese: 由于我纯粹因惊慌而做的事，他们认为我很有勇气。

name: delivery
trans: n. 投递, 送交投递的邮件, 发送的货物分娩讲话方式, 演讲风格

sentences.english: Most Indian restaurants offer free delivery.
sentences.chinese: 大多数印度餐馆提供免费外送服务。

sentences.english: You can expect delivery in a week to ten days.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在一周至十天内收到货物。

sentences.english: fresh milk deliveries
sentences.chinese: 新鲜牛奶递送

sentences.english: Mrs Howell had an easy delivery.
sentences.chinese: 豪厄尔太太的分娩很顺利。

detailed_translations.english: the act of bringing goods, letters etc to a particular person or place, or the things that are brought

name: prejudice
trans: n. 成见, 偏见, 歧视
vt. 使有偏见不利于, 损害

sentences.english: Women still face prejudice in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 女性在职场中仍然面临歧视。

sentences.english: It takes a long time to overcome these kinds of prejudices.
sentences.chinese: 战胜这些偏见需要假以时日。

sentences.english: There was concern that reports in the media would prejudice the jury.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心媒体的报道会影响陪审团的公正性。

detailed_translations.english: an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval
to influence someone so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about someone or something

name: repulsive
trans: adj. 令人厌恶的,可憎的副 词:repulsively

sentences.english: Many people find slugs repulsive.
sentences.chinese: 很多人觉得鼻涕虫让人恶心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 排斥的；令人厌恶的；击退的；冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: extremely unpleas-ant, in a way that almost makes you feel sick

name: demanding
trans: adj. 很费心的, 很费力的

sentences.english: a demanding job
sentences.chinese: 高要求的工作

detailed_translations.chinese: 苛求的；要求高的；吃力的
detailed_translations.english: needing a lot of ability, effort, or skill

name: tranquility
trans: n. 平静;安静;安宁平稳;稳定

sentences.english: We all like the tranquility of the country life.
sentences.chinese: 我们都喜欢乡村生活的宁静。

sentences.english: For this brings not only the tranquility which comes from doing well, but also that which comes from doing few things.
sentences.chinese: 因为这不仅带来由于做事适当而产生的宁静，而且带来由于做很少的事而产生的宁静。

sentences.english: And while I love my family to death, this time of tranquility is one of absolute bliss for me.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我对我的家庭爱得要死，但这片刻的宁静绝对是我的幸福之一。

name: demonstrate
trans: vi. 举行示威游行(或集会)
vt. 说明, 演示论证, 证明显示, 表露

sentences.english: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.

sentences.chinese: 防止歧视的法律

sentences.english: shape discrimination
sentences.chinese: 形状识别力

detailed_translations.english: the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way

sentences.english: He was one of those men who manipulated people.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种要摆布别人的人。

sentences.english: You have the constant feeling you are being manipulated.
sentences.chinese: 你总感觉自己是被人控制着的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone think and behave exactly as you want them to, by skilfully deceiving or influencing them

name: discuss
trans: 时态:discussed, discussing, discusses名 词:discusser

sentences.english: Littman refused to discuss the case publicly.
sentences.chinese: 利特曼拒绝公开讨论此案。

sentences.english: If you would like to discuss the matter further, please call me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想进一步讨论此事，请打电话给我。

sentences.english: This topic will be discussed in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 该主题将在第四章进行详述。

detailed_translations.english: to talk about something with another person or a group in order to exchange ideas or decide something

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

sentences.english: class discussions
sentences.chinese: 课堂讨论

sentences.english: the topics suggested for discussion
sentences.chinese: 建议讨论的话题

sentences.english: We have had discussions about her legal situation.
sentences.chinese: 我们就她的法律状况已进行了讨论。

detailed_translations.english: when you discuss something

name: priority
trans: n. 优先；优先权；优先次序；优先考虑的事

sentences.english: The club’s priority is to win the League.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

sentences.english: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (= very important and needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后，治安成了当务之急。

sentences.english: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (= not important and not needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 可用的钱这么少，只好暂时放下维修事宜了。

sentences.english: The customer is high on our list of priorities .
sentences.chinese: 顾客在我们的心目中排在第一位。

sentences.english: List your tasks in order of priority (= most important first ) .
sentences.chinese: 按照轻重缓急列出你的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else

sentences.english: a serving dish
sentences.chinese: 上菜用的盘子

sentences.english: an ovenproof dish
sentences.chinese: 耐热盘

sentences.english: The menu includes a wide selection of vegetarian dishes.
sentences.chinese: 菜单上有品种丰富的素食。

detailed_translations.english: a flat container with low sides, for serving food from or cooking food in

sentences.english: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the factory.
sentences.chinese: 厂区严禁吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that an action is illegal or not allowed

name: dismiss
trans: vt. 让...离开；开除；解散；解雇

sentences.english: He just laughed and dismissed my proposal as unrealistic.
sentences.chinese: 他只是笑了笑，认为我的建议不切实际，拒绝考虑。

sentences.english: Bryant was unfairly dismissed from his post.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩特被无理免职了。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to consider someone’s idea, opinion etc, because you think it is not serious, true, or important

name: dismissive
trans: adj. 轻视的, 轻蔑的, 鄙视的

name: remind
trans: 时态:reminded, reminding, reminds名 词:reminder

sentences.english: Yes, I’ll be there. Thanks for reminding me.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我会去那里的。 谢谢提醒。

sentences.english: He made a few notes to remind himself of what he wanted to say.
sentences.chinese: 他记了几条，提醒自己要说些什么。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone remember something that they must do

name: sustain
trans: vt. 承受，支撑维持长期保持；使继续经受，遭受

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

name: disposable
trans: adj. 一次使用后即丢掉的, 一次性的(纳税后的钱)可自由支配的

sentences.english: disposable resources
sentences.chinese: 可支配的资源

sentences.english: Currently, disposables account for about 80% to 85% of the $3 billion-plus annual diaper market.
sentences.chinese: 目前，一次性尿布占年销售额30多亿美元的尿布市场的80%至85%左右。

detailed_translations.english: available to be used

detailed_translations.chinese: 一次性物品， 不回收物品
detailed_translations.english: Disposable products can be referred to as disposables

name: undertake
trans: vt. 担任，承揽；保证着手，开始

sentences.english: University professors both teach and undertake research.
sentences.chinese: 大学教授既要教学又要从事研究工作。

sentences.english: He undertook to pay the money back in six months.
sentences.chinese: 他保证在六个月之内还钱。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself responsible for sth and start doing it

name: dispose
trans: vi. 处理；安排；（能够）决定
时态:disposed, disposing, disposes名 词:disposer

sentences.english: Chinese vases are disposed around the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 中国花瓶摆放在展馆四周。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things or put them in their places

sentences.english: Her face hadn’t altered much over the years.
sentences.chinese: 过了这么多年，她的容貌并没有多大改变。

sentences.english: The city centre has altered beyond recognition (=  changed very much  ) .
sentences.chinese: 市中心变得都认不出来了。

sentences.english: Nothing can alter the fact that the refugees are our responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 我们有责任帮助难民，这一事实无法改变。

detailed_translations.english: to change, or to make someone or something change

name: assurance
trans: n. 保证, 担保, 确信把握, 信心(人寿)保险

sentences.english: Despite my repeated assurances, Rob still looked very nervous.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我再三保证，罗布看起来还是很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: a promise that something will definitely happen or is definitely true, made especially to make someone less worried

name: disruption
trans: n. 中断,分裂,瓦解,破坏

sentences.english: The strike caused widespread disruption .
sentences.chinese: 罢工造成了大规模的混乱。

name: clarify
trans: vi. 得到澄清；变得明晰；得到净化
时态:clarified, clarifying, clarifies名 词:clarification

sentences.english: Reporters asked him to clarify his position (= say exactly what his beliefs are ) on welfare reform.
sentences.chinese: 记者们要求他阐明他在福利改革问题上的立场。

detailed_translations.english: to make something clearer or easier to understand

name: discard
trans: n. 抛弃；被丢弃的东西或人

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer's guidelines before discarding the box.
sentences.chinese: 先阅读制造商的说明书再把盒子丢掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃
detailed_translations.english: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it

name: distinguish
trans: vt. & vi. 辨别, 区别
vt. 显扬自己, 使自己扬名

sentences.english: The factor that distinguishes this company from the competition is customer service.
sentences.chinese: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

sentences.english: The main distinguishing feature of this species is the leaf shape.
sentences.chinese: 这一品种的主要特征是叶子的形状。

detailed_translations.english: to be the thing that makes someone or something different or special

name: entitle
trans: vt. 称做…；定名为…；给…称号；使…有权利
时态:entitled, entitling, entitles名 词:entitlement

sentences.english: They understood that our power alone cannot protect us, nor does it entitle us to do as we please.
sentences.chinese: 他们懂得单凭实力无法保护我们的安全，实力也并不赋予我们随心所欲的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the official right to do or have something

name: distribute
trans: vt. 分配，分给散发；散播；分布

sentences.english: a man distributing leaflets to passers-by
sentences.chinese: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

sentences.english: Make sure that your weight is evenly distributed.
sentences.chinese: 注意让你的重量分布均匀。

detailed_translations.english: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way

name: exhibition
trans: n. 展览, 展览会表现, 显示公开示范表演

sentences.english: All visitors to the exhibition must report to the main service desk.
sentences.chinese: 到展览会参观的人都必须先到总服务台报到。

sentences.english: Our country will tie up with another country to host this exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 我国将和另外一个国家联合主办这次展览会。

sentences.english: You go to the exhibition centre, I must hie myself to tell the new matters.
sentences.chinese: 你去展览中心吧，我得赶紧汇报一下这个新情况。

detailed_translations.english: a show of paintings, photographs, or other objects that people can go to see

name: distribution
trans: n. 分发, 分配散布, 分布

sentences.english: a distribution centre
sentences.chinese: 经销中心

detailed_translations.english: the act of sharing things among a large group of people in a planned way

name: impact
trans: vt. 撞击；冲突；影响；压紧
n. 效果；影响；碰撞；冲击力IMPACTabbr. Implementation Planning and Control Technique (电子计算机)程序设计及操作控制技术
时态:impacted, impacting, impacts名 词:impaction

sentences.english: Such schemes mean little unless they impact people.
sentences.chinese: 除非能对人们造成影响，否则这样的计划意义不大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 影响， 作用， 冲击
detailed_translations.english: to have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something
the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

sentences.english: The first quarter dividend has been increased by nearly 4 percent.
sentences.chinese: 第一季度的股息增加了近4％。

detailed_translations.chinese: 红利；股息；[数] 被除数；奖金
detailed_translations.english: a part of a company’s profit that is divided among the people with  share s  in the company

name: incentive
trans: n. 激励某人做某事的事物；刺激；诱因，动机

sentences.english: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
sentences.chinese: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

detailed_translations.english: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

name: instruct
trans: vt. 命令；教授；指导；通知

sentences.english: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed (= as she had been told ).
sentences.chinese: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

sentences.english: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
sentences.chinese: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

sentences.english: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
sentences.chinese: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell someone what to do

name: donate
trans: 时态:donated, donating, donates名 词:donator

sentences.english: people who volunteer to donate blood
sentences.chinese: 自愿献血者

detailed_translations.english: to give something, especially money, to a person or an organization in order to help them

sentences.english: My daughter-in-law said that I was interfering, but I was only trying to help.
sentences.chinese: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事，但我只是想帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

sentences.english: There have been generous donations from EU funds.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟基金给予了慷慨的捐款。

detailed_translations.english: something, especially money, that you give to a person or an organ-ization in order to help them

name: involve
trans: vt. 包含；牵涉；使陷于；潜心于
时态:involved, involving, involves名 词:involvement

sentences.english: What will the job involve?
sentences.chinese: 这份工作包括什么？

sentences.english: I didn’t realize putting on a play involved so much work.
sentences.chinese: 我没想到上演一出戏剧需要做这么多的工作。

detailed_translations.english: if an activity or situation involves something, that thing is part of it or a result of it

name: double
trans: adj. 双的, 双重的供两人用的, 双人的两面派的, 虚伪的
n. 两倍, 双份极为相似的人
vt. & vi. 是…的两倍, (使)加倍兼任, 兼作
时态:doubled, doubling, doubles名 词:doubleness

sentences.english: a double sink
sentences.chinese: 双水槽

sentences.english: a double wardrobe
sentences.chinese: 双门衣柜

sentences.english: the great double doors of the cathedral
sentences.chinese: 大教堂宏伟的双开大门

sentences.english: Don’t park your car on double yellow lines.
sentences.chinese: 不可以在双黄线处停车。

sentences.english: The city was enclosed by walls of double thickness.
sentences.chinese: 该城被两倍厚的墙围了起来。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of two parts that are similar or exactly the same

name: merit
trans: n. 功勋，功劳；价值长处，优点

sentences.english: The merit of the report is its realistic assessment of the changes required.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的优点就是它对所要求的变动进行了实事求是的评估。

sentences.english: The great merit of the project is its flexibility and low cost.
sentences.chinese: 该项目最大的优点是它的灵活性和低成本。

sentences.english: Each of these approaches to teaching has its merits .
sentences.chinese: 这些教学方法每一种都有其优点。

sentences.english: Tonight’s meeting will weigh up the relative merits of the two candidates.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的会议将对两位候选人的相对优点进行考量。

sentences.english: It’s a fascinating book which merits attention.
sentences.chinese: 这是本引人入胜的书，值得关注。

detailed_translations.english: an advantage or good feature of something
to be good, important, or serious enough for praise or attention

name: permit
trans: 时态:permitted, permitting, permits名 词:permittee

sentences.english: Smoking is only permitted in the public lounge.
sentences.chinese: 只允许在公共休息室里抽烟。

sentences.english: He had more than the permitted level of alcohol in his blood.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量超出了允许的水平。

detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, especially by an official decision, rule, or law
an official written statement giving you the right to do something

name: downsize
trans: vt. 以较小尺寸设计；缩小尺寸；裁减人数

sentences.english: American manufacturing organizations have been downsizing their factories.
sentences.chinese: 美国制造商们一直在缩小他们工厂的规模。

sentences.english: ...today's downsized economy.
sentences.chinese: … 今天萎缩了的经济。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩小尺寸； 缩小规模
detailed_translations.english: To downsize something such as a business or industry means to make it smaller

name: proceed
trans: vi. 前进；行进进行；继续下去

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

sentences.english: America’s current economic downturn
sentences.chinese: 美国目前经济的衰退

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰退（经济方面）；低迷时期
detailed_translations.english: a period or process in which business activity, production etc is reduced and conditions become worse

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

sentences.english: a gentle downward slope
sentences.chinese: 缓坡

sentences.english: Benedict pointed downward again with his stick.
sentences.chinese: 贝内迪克特又用他的拐杖向下指了指。

detailed_translations.english: moving or pointing towards a lower position
towards a lower level or position

name: risk
trans: n. 危险(性)，风险引起危险的事物

sentences.english: Skiers always face the risk of serious injury.
sentences.chinese: 滑雪者始终面临着受重伤的风险。

sentences.english: It was a risk, sending a letter to my house.
sentences.chinese: 将信寄到我家是冒险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that something bad, unpleasant, or dangerous may happen

name: dramatic
trans: adj. 戏剧的, 剧本的戏剧性的, 激动人心的引人注目的, 给人深刻印象的副 词:dramatically

sentences.english: A superb goal by Owen earned United a dramatic victory yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天欧文的一个超级入球为联队赢得了激动人心的胜利。

sentences.english: Some of the most dramatic events in American history happened here.
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上一些最震撼人心的事件发生在这里。

sentences.english: the dramatic scenery of the Grand Canyon
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷的壮丽景致

detailed_translations.chinese: 引人注目的， 激动人心的； 戏剧的
detailed_translations.english: exciting or impressive

name: submit
trans: vt. 提交, 呈递〈正〉建议, 主张, 申辩
时态:submitted, submitting, submits名 词:submittal

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心
detailed_translations.english: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

name: drastic
trans: n. 烈性泻药副 词:drastically

sentences.english: drastic cuts in government spending
sentences.chinese: 政府开支的急剧削减

sentences.english: Drastic changesare needed if environmental catastrophe is to be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 要想避免环境灾难就需要重大的变革。

detailed_translations.english: extreme and sudden

name: speculate
trans: vt. & vi. 思索；猜测，推测

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: drastically
trans: v. 大大地;彻底地激烈地

sentences.english: Output has been drastically reduced.
sentences.chinese: 产量已急剧下降。

sentences.english: Things have started to go drastically wrong.
sentences.chinese: 情况变得完全失控。

name: verify
trans: 时态:verified verifying, verifies名 词:verifier

sentences.english: I verified the source from which I had that information.
sentences.chinese: 我核实了我获知那条信息的来源。

sentences.english: His statement was verified by several witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 他的说法得到了几位证人的证实。

detailed_translations.english: to discover whether something is correct or true

name: draw
trans: vt. & vi. 绘画, 画拖, 拉
vt. 拔出, 取出, 抽出提取, 汲取, 领取引起, 吸引
vi. 移动, 来临打成平局, 不分胜负
n. 抽奖, 抽签平局, 不分胜负

sentences.english: Katie had drawn a cottage with a little stream running next to it.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂画了一间小茅舍，旁边流淌着一条小溪。

sentences.english: She asked the little girl to draw a picture of the man she’d spoken to.
sentences.chinese: 她让小女孩把刚才和她说话的那个男人画出来。

sentences.english: Keith was drawing a complicated-looking graph.
sentences.chinese: 基思在画一张看上去很复杂的图表。

sentences.english: I’ve never been able to draw very well.
sentences.chinese: 我从来就画不好图画。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc

name: absurd
trans: n. 荒诞；荒诞作品名 词:absurdity

sentences.english: It seems an absurd idea.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎是个荒唐的想法。

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or unreasonable

sentences.english: She took a file from her desk drawer .
sentences.chinese: 她从书桌的抽屉里拿出了一个文件夹。

sentences.english: The scissors are in the kitchen drawer (= drawer in a piece of kitchen furniture ) .
sentences.chinese: 剪刀在厨房的抽屉里。

detailed_translations.english: part of a piece of furniture, such as a desk, that you pull out and push in and use to keep things in

name: adequate
trans: adj. 充分的, 足够的适当的, 胜任的名 词:adequacy

sentences.english: Farmers have been slow to make adequate provision for their retirement.

detailed_translations.english: very unusual or surprising

sentences.chinese: 这家制鞋厂是本地区最大的雇主。

detailed_translations.english: a person, company, or organization that employs people

name: fragile
trans: adj. 易碎的，脆的虚弱的，脆弱的；经不起折腾的名 词:fragility

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

name: employment
trans: n. 雇用, 就业职业, 工作使用, 运用有益的活动

sentences.english: She was offered employment in the sales office.
sentences.chinese: 她获聘在销售部工作。

sentences.english: terms and conditions of employment
sentences.chinese: 雇用条款和条件

sentences.english: Steve’s still looking for full-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫还在寻找全职工作。

sentences.english: the needs of women who combine paid employment and care for their families
sentences.chinese: 兼顾有薪工作和照料家庭的女性的需要

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作； 雇用； 使用
detailed_translations.english: the condition of having a paid job

name: inferior
trans: adj. 下级的，下等的；差的；自卑的
n. 次品；下级名 词:inferiority

sentences.english: I felt very inferior among all those academics.
sentences.chinese: 与那些大学教师在一起，我自惭形秽。

sentences.english: wine of inferior quality
sentences.chinese: 劣质葡萄酒

sentences.english: inferior goods
sentences.chinese: 质量低劣的商品

detailed_translations.english: not good, or not as good as someone or something else
