name: enable
trans: vt. 使能够；提供做…的权利[措施]使可能

sentences.english: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
sentences.chinese: 新的检验使医生能在早期发现该种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

name: initial
trans: vt. 用姓名的首字母签名
also initialled initialinginitialling initialsinitials副 词:initially

sentences.english: an initial investment of £5,000
sentences.chinese: 5,000英镑的初始投资

sentences.english: The initial response has been encouraging.
sentences.chinese: 最初的反应情况很乐观。

detailed_translations.english: happening at the beginning
the first letter of someone’s first name

name: irresistible
trans: adj. 不可抵抗的；不能压制的；极为诱人的副 词:irresistibly

sentences.english: I was overcome by an irresistible urge to cry.
sentences.chinese: 我控制不住想大哭一场。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可抵抗的,不能压制的
detailed_translations.english: too strong or powerful to be stopped or prevented

name: encourage
trans: vt. 鼓励, 激励促进, 助长, 激发

sentences.english: I want to thank everyone who has encouraged and supported me.
sentences.chinese: 我要感谢每一位鼓励和支持过我的人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something

name: miscellaneous
trans: adj. 不同种类的，多种多样的；混杂的ad
v. 不同种类地，多种多样地；混杂地

sentences.english: a miscellaneous assortment of books
sentences.chinese: 各种各样的书籍

sentences.english: They receive a grant of £1,094 to cover the cost of miscellaneous expenses.
sentences.chinese: 他们获得1,094英镑的津贴用于支付各种开支。

detailed_translations.chinese: 混杂的，各种各样的；多方面的，多才多艺的
detailed_translations.english: a miscellaneous set of things or people includes many different things or people that do not seem to be connected with each other

sentences.english: She was pushed beyond her powers of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 她被逼得忍无可忍。

sentences.english: The marathon is a test of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 马拉松赛跑是对耐力的考验。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to continue doing something difficult or painful over a long period of time

name: noteworthy
trans: adj. 值得注意的；显著的；重要的比较级:noteworthier，noteworthiest副 词:noteworthily

sentences.english: a noteworthy achievement
sentences.chinese: 显著的成就

detailed_translations.chinese: 显著的， 值得注目的
detailed_translations.english: important or interesting enough to deserve your attention

sentences.english: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
sentences.chinese: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

name: rapid
trans: adj. 〈正〉快的；急速的比较级:rapider，rapidest名 词:rapidity

sentences.english: The patient made a rapid recovery.
sentences.chinese: 病人迅速康复。

sentences.english: a period of rapid decline
sentences.chinese: 迅速衰退期

sentences.english: He fired three times in rapid succession (= one after another ) .
sentences.chinese: 他接连开了三枪。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done very quickly and in a very short time

name: self-explanatory
trans: adj. 不解自明的;明显的

name: engineering
trans: n. 工程(学), 工程师行业

sentences.english: The bridge is a triumph of modern engineering.
sentences.chinese: 这座桥是现代工程的一大成就。

sentences.english: a degree in engineering
sentences.chinese: 工程学学位

detailed_translations.english: the activity of applying scientific knowledge to the design, building and control of machines, roads, bridges, electrical equipment, etc.

name: sufficient
trans: adj. 足够的; 充足的副 词:sufficiently

sentences.english: We can only prosecute if there is sufficient evidence.
sentences.chinese: 有了足够的证据，我们才能提出起诉。

sentences.english: Unauthorized absence is sufficient reason for dismissal.
sentences.chinese: 旷工足以成为解雇的理由。

sentences.english: We need sufficient time to deal with the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要足够的时间来处理这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: as much as is needed for a particular purpose

name: enhance
trans: vt. 提高, 增加, 加强
时态:enhanced, enhancing, enhances名 词:enhancement

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

sentences.english: Ultimately, the decision rests with the child’s parents.
sentences.chinese: 最终，决定权在这孩子的父母手中。

sentences.english: a long but ultimately successful campaign
sentences.chinese: 一场历时很久但最终成功的运动

detailed_translations.english: finally, after everything else has been done or considered

name: enroll
trans: v. 【美】（使）加入；注册；登记；招收（成员）；招（生）登记入学；注册（课程）（【英】enrol）

sentences.english: You need to enroll before the end of August.
sentences.chinese: 你必须在八月底前注册。

detailed_translations.english: to officially arrange to join a school, university, or course, or to arrange for someone else to do this

name: vague
trans: adj. 不明确的；含糊的；模糊的；暧昧的比较级:vaguer, vaguest副 词:vaguely

sentences.english: The governor gave only a vague outline of his tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不明确的； 含糊的； 暧昧的
detailed_translations.english: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

sentences.english: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to make certain that something will happen properly

name: vivid
trans: adj. 鲜明的；鲜艳的；生动的比较级:vivider, vividest副 词:vividly

sentences.english: I’ve got vivid memories of that summer.
sentences.chinese: 我对那年夏天记忆犹新。

sentences.english: He had a vivid picture of her in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑海中清晰地留着她的形象。

detailed_translations.english: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

name: enthusiastically
trans: v. 热心地;满腔热情地

sentences.english: The others barely glanced at it and went back to their shovels, almost enthusiastically, searching for the French Woman, but I went up to the body and forced myself to look at it closely.
sentences.chinese: 其他的人几乎连看都没看上一眼，就拿起他们的锹，差不多都很热心地去寻找那个法国女人的尸体，但我凑到那具尸体前，迫使我自己仔细地看看。

name: entitlement
trans: n. 授权, 有资格有权得到的东西

sentences.english: They lose their entitlement to welfare when they start work.
sentences.chinese: 他们开始工作时就丧失了享受福利的权利。

detailed_translations.english: the official right to have or do something, or the amount that you have a right to receive

name: entrée
trans: n. 主菜两道正菜(鱼和肉)之间的小菜入场权

name: environment
trans: n. 环境, 周围状况, 自然环境

sentences.english: Some of these chemicals are very damaging to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些化学品中有些对环境非常有害。

sentences.english: legislation to protect the environment
sentences.chinese: 保护环境的法规

sentences.english: the effects of acid rain on the environment
sentences.chinese: 酸雨对环境的影响

sentences.english: the government minister for the environment
sentences.chinese: 负责环境事务的政府部长

detailed_translations.english: the air, water, and land on Earth, which is affected by man’s activities

name: environmental
trans: adj. 自然环境的，生态环境的；环保的，生态环境保护的；与周围环境有关的，由生存环境引起的副 词:environmentally

sentences.english: the environmental damage caused by the chemical industry
sentences.chinese: 化学工业对环境造成的破坏

sentences.english: an international meeting to discuss environmental issues
sentences.chinese: 探讨环境问题的国际会议

sentences.english: the environmental impact of pollution from cars
sentences.chinese: 汽车造成的污染对环境的影响

sentences.english: an environmental group
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织

detailed_translations.english: concerning or affecting the air, land, or water on Earth

name: essential
trans: adj. 基本的；必要的；本质的；精华的
n. 本质；要素；要点；必需品

sentences.english: Window locks are fairly cheap and absolutely essential.
sentences.chinese: 窗锁相当便宜，绝对有必要安装。

sentences.english: Even in small companies, computers are an essential tool.
sentences.chinese: 即使在小公司里，计算机也是不可或缺的工具。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary
something that is necessary to do something or in a particular situation

name: evaluate
trans: vt. 评价, 估计, 估价
时态:evaluated, evaluating, evaluates名 词:evaluation

sentences.english: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.english: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
sentences.chinese: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。

detailed_translations.english: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

name: event
trans: n. 事件, 大事运动项目形容词:eventless

sentences.english: one of the most important events in the history of mankind
sentences.chinese: 人类历史上最重大的事件之一

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially something important, interesting or unusual

name: evidence
trans: n. 证据，证明；迹象；明显

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

sentences.english: The school has evolved its own style of teaching.
sentences.chinese: 学校逐步形成了自己的教学风格。

sentences.english: Businesses need to evolve rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 各项业务需要快速发展。

detailed_translations.english: to develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: exact
trans: adj. 精确的；准确的，精密的

sentences.english: Police are still investigating the exact cause of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 警方还在调查这起事故的确切原因。

sentences.english: What were his exact words?
sentences.chinese: 他的原话是什么？

sentences.english: The timing had to be exact.
sentences.chinese: 对时机的把握必须精确。

sentences.english: Some concepts in Chinese medicine have no exact equivalent in Western medicine.
sentences.chinese: 中医的一些概念在西医中没有完全一样的对应观念。

detailed_translations.english: completely correct in every detail
to demand and get something from someone by using threats, force etc

name: examination
trans: n. 检查，调查考试；考查；试题讯问

sentences.english: The examination results will be announced in September.
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩将于9月公布。

sentences.english: He’s already taken the entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 他已经参加了入学考试。

sentences.english: The proposals are still under examination.
sentences.chinese: 那些提案还在审查之中。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written test of knowledge, especially an important one

name: examine
trans: vt. 仔细检查考试, 对…进行考核审查, 审问

sentences.english: A team of divers was sent down to examine the wreck.
sentences.chinese: 一组潜水员被送到水下检查沉船。

sentences.english: Hegel’s philosophy will be examined in detail in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 黑格尔的哲学将在第4章作详细探讨。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something carefully and thoroughly because you want to find out more about it

name: excel
trans: vi. 胜过他人；优秀Excel微软公司生产的表格处理软件

sentences.english: You have excelled yourself with the new exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 你新办的这次展览特别成功。

detailed_translations.english: to do something very well, or much better than most people
to do something very well, or much better than most people

name: excellent
trans: adj. 优秀的, 卓越的, 杰出的副 词:excellently

sentences.english: an excellent suggestion
sentences.chinese: 极好的建议

sentences.english: His car is in excellent condition.
sentences.chinese: 他的汽车状况极佳。

sentences.english: Second-hand computers can be excellent value.
sentences.chinese: 二手计算机买得好会非常合算。

detailed_translations.english: extremely good or of very high quality

name: excursion
trans: n. 远足, 短途旅行

sentences.english: They've gone on an excursion to York.
sentences.chinese: 他们到约克旅游去了。

detailed_translations.english: a short journey made for pleasure, especially one that has been organized for a group of people

name: exhibit
trans: vt. 显示；展览；提出（证据等）
n. 展览品；证据；展示会

sentences.english: Her paintings have been exhibited all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的绘画作品在世界各地展出。

detailed_translations.english: to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it
something, for example a painting, that is put in a public place so that people can go to see it

name: expansion
trans: n. 扩大, 扩张, 扩展, 膨胀扩张物, 膨胀物

sentences.english: The industry underwent a period of rapid expansion.
sentences.chinese: 该产业经历了一轮快速扩张。

detailed_translations.english: when something increases in size, range, amount etc

trans: vt. 预料；预期认为(某事)会发生；认为(某人)会来；预计理应得到；期望，期待；期盼猜想；认为某事是真实的

sentences.english: He will be hard to beat. I fully expect (= am completely sure about ) that and I’m ready.
sentences.chinese: 他很难击败。我确信这一点，不过我准备好了。

sentences.english: ‘Who are you?’ he murmured, only half expecting (= thinking it was possible, but not likely ) her to answer.
sentences.chinese: “你是谁？”他低声问道，预计她可能不会回答。

sentences.english: to expect a visit/call/letter from sb
sentences.chinese: 等待某人的来访 / 电话 / 来信

detailed_translations.english: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned

name: expectation
trans: n. 预料; 期望有信心的指望

sentences.english: Having raised expectations (= made people more hopeful ), he went on to help only a few people.
sentences.chinese: 他唤起了大家的希望，但接着只是帮助了几个人。

sentences.english: The show exceeded all expectations (= was much better than expected ).
sentences.chinese: 这场演出比人们预期的要好得多。

sentences.english: The number of people who attended fell short of expectations (= was lower than expected ).
sentences.chinese: 出席的人数比预期的要少。

detailed_translations.english: what you think or hope will happen

name: expensive
trans: adj. 昂贵的, 花钱多的副 词:expensively

sentences.english: the most expensive restaurant in town
sentences.chinese: 城里最贵的餐馆

sentences.english: Petrol is becoming more and more expensive.
sentences.chinese: 汽油越来越贵了。

sentences.english: Photography is an expensive hobby.
sentences.chinese: 摄影是一项很花钱的业余爱好。

sentences.english: For low-income families, children’s safety equipment can be prohibitively expensive (= so expensive that most people cannot afford it ).
sentences.chinese: 对于低收入家庭来说，儿童的安全设备贵得让人望而却步。

sentences.english: Employing the wrong builder can be a horribly expensive mistake.
sentences.chinese: 用错建筑工人有时会是代价高昂的错误。

sentences.english: Her husband had expensive tastes (= liked expensive things ).
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫喜欢的东西都很贵。

detailed_translations.english: costing a lot of money

name: experience
trans: n. 经验，体验经历；阅历；感受，体会
vt. 经历，体验；感受，遭受

sentences.english: The advice in the booklet reflects the practical experience we have gained (= experience gained by actually doing something, rather than knowledge from books etc ).
sentences.chinese: 小册子中的建议反映了我们所获得的实践经验。

sentences.english: I had some experience in fashion design.
sentences.chinese: 我有一些时装设计方面的经验。

sentences.english: She was turned down on the grounds of lack of experience.
sentences.chinese: 她因缺乏经验而被拒绝。

sentences.english: The book is based on personal experience .
sentences.chinese: 本书是根据个人经历写成的。

detailed_translations.english: knowledge or skill that you gain from doing a job or activity, or the process of doing this

name: experienced
trans: adj. 有经验的, 老练的, 经验丰富的

sentences.english: an experienced pilot
sentences.chinese: 经验丰富的飞行员

sentences.english: an experienced public speaker
sentences.chinese: 老练的公开演讲者

sentences.english: She is experienced and self-assured.
sentences.chinese: 她经验丰富且充满自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 老练的，熟练的；富有经验的
detailed_translations.english: possessing skills or knowledge because you have done something often or for a long time

sentences.english: The teacher provided some different materials and left the children to experiment.
sentences.chinese: 老师提供了几种不同的材料让孩子们试验。

detailed_translations.english: to try using various ideas, methods etc to find out how good or effective they are
a scientific test done to find out how something reacts under certain conditions, or to find out if a particular idea is true

name: exploration
trans: n. 探险旅行；搜寻考察，探索形容词:exploratory

sentences.english: oil exploration facilities in the North Sea
sentences.chinese: 北海的石油勘探设施

sentences.english: You can then use this hut as a base for explorations into the mountains around.
sentences.chinese: 你到时可以把这间小屋当大本营，去周围的山里探险。

detailed_translations.english: the act of travelling through a place in order to find out about it or find something such as oil or gold in it

sentences.english: Management need to explore ways of improving office security.
sentences.chinese: 管理层需要探讨如何加强办事处的安全措施。

sentences.english: I’m going to explore the possibility of a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 我要好好想想兼职工作的可能性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 探险， 探索； 仔细查阅， 探究
detailed_translations.english: to discuss or think about something carefully

name: express
trans: vt. 表达, 表示, 陈述特快发送, 快运
adj. 特快的, 高速的〈正〉明确的丝毫不差的ad
时态:expressed, expressing, expresses名 词:expresser

sentences.english: Parents have expressed their concerns about their children’s safety.
sentences.chinese: 父母对自己孩子的安全表示忧虑。

sentences.english: She expressed an interest in seeing York.
sentences.chinese: 她表示有兴趣见见约克。

sentences.english: Many people have expressed their opposition to the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 许多人反对这些提议。

sentences.english: He first learnt to express himself through movement at his dance classes.
sentences.chinese: 他最初是在舞蹈班学会通过动作表达情感的。

sentences.english: Words can’t express (= it is impossible to describe ) how angry we felt.
sentences.chinese: 我们的愤怒无以言表。

sentences.english: London–Gatwick Express/Orient Express (=a fast train or bus which does a particular journey regularly)
sentences.chinese: 伦敦﹣盖特威克快车/东方快车

sentences.english: Send these books by express.
sentences.chinese: 把这些书用快递寄出去。

detailed_translations.english: to tell or show what you are feeling or thinking by using words, looks, or actions
a train or bus that does not stop in many places and therefore travels quickly

name: external

sentences.english: the sense of grievance which characterized him as a young man

detailed_translations.english: a belief that you have been treated unfairly, or an unfair situation or event that affects and upsets you

sentences.english: Grill the bacon until crisp.
sentences.chinese: 将培根烤至酥脆。

sentences.english: swordfish grilled over charcoal
sentences.chinese: 炭火烤的剑鱼

detailed_translations.english: if you grill something, or if it grills, you cook it by putting it on a flat metal frame with bars across it, above or below strong direct heat
a part of a  cooker  in which strong heat from above cooks food on a metal shelf below

name: growth
trans: n. 生长，发育增加；发展，扩大生长物

sentences.english: measures to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 刺激经济增长的措施

detailed_translations.english: an increase in amount, number, or size

name: guarantee
trans: vt. 保证；担保使(事情)可能发生
n. 保证，保障；保证书；保用期担保，担保人担保品，抵押品

sentences.english: The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
sentences.chinese: 只有我父母作担保，银行才会给我贷款。

sentences.english: I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能保证一定会成功。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
a formal promise that something will be done

name: H
trans: n. 字母hHabbr. hard （铅笔心硬度）硬hydrogen 氢

name: handle
trans: vt. 买卖；处理；操作；触摸；运用

sentences.english: I handled most of the paperwork.
sentences.chinese: 大部分文书工作是我做的。

sentences.english: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 此案正由一位顶尖律师负责处理。

sentences.english: The finance department handles all the accounts.
sentences.chinese: 财务部处理所有账目。

sentences.english: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
sentences.chinese: 计算机能处理大量数据。

detailed_translations.english: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job

name: handy
trans: adj. 手边的，就近的；便利的；容易取得的；敏捷的比较级:handier, handiest名 词:handiness

sentences.english: It’s quite a handy little tool.
sentences.chinese: 这件小工具非常有用。

sentences.english: It’s very handy having a light above your desk.
sentences.chinese: 书桌上方有盏灯很有用。

sentences.english: Take your swimming trunks with you – they might come in handy (= be useful ).
sentences.chinese: 带上你的游泳裤，可能会派上用场的。

detailed_translations.english: useful

name: harbor
trans: n. （海）港；港口；港湾（【英式英语】harbour）
v. 庇护，窝藏，藏匿（罪犯或赃物）怀有，心怀（尤指反面感情或想法）携带（细菌等，可导致疾病的传播）
时态:harbors, harboring, harbored名 词:harborer

sentences.english: All the battleships can refresh in this harbor.
sentences.chinese: 所有战舰都能在这个港口装上补充供应品。

sentences.english: It is the harbor of Athens.
sentences.chinese: 它是雅典的港口城。

sentences.english: She stands on a small island in New York harbor, near the great city.
sentences.chinese: 她竖立在纽约海港的一座小岛，并紧挨着纽约这座大城市。

name: harmful
trans: adj. 能造成损害的；有害的副 词:harmfully

sentences.english: the harmful effects of smoking
sentences.chinese: 吸烟的害处

detailed_translations.english: causing harm

sentences.english: the disposal of hazardous waste
sentences.chinese: 有害废弃物的处理

detailed_translations.english: dangerous, especially to people’s health or safety

name: hesitate
trans: vt. 踌躇，犹豫；有疑虑，不愿意
时态:hesitated, hesitating, hesitates副 词:hesitatingly

sentences.english: I hesitate.
sentences.chinese: 我犹豫。

detailed_translations.english: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous

trans: n. 犹豫, 踌躇, 不愿犹豫(之事或行为)

sentences.english: After some hesitation one of them began to speak.
sentences.chinese: 犹豫了一会儿之后，他们中有一个人开口了。

detailed_translations.english: when someone hesitates

name: hide
trans: n. 兽皮, 皮革〈口〉人的皮肤〈口〉生命
时态:hid hidden , hid hiding, hides

sentences.english: She keeps a bottle of gin hidden behind a stack of books.
sentences.chinese: 她在一堆书的后面藏了一瓶杜松子酒。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately put or keep something or someone in a place where they cannot easily be seen or found

name: highlight
trans: vt. 强调, 突出, 使显著
n. 最精彩的部分, 最重要的事情

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

name: highly
trans: v. 非常；高度地；非常赞许地

sentences.english: Tom’s mother was highly critical of the school’s approach.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的母亲对学校的处理方法持强烈的批评态度。

sentences.english: highly competitive industries
sentences.chinese: 竞争非常激烈的行业

sentences.english: a highly desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 宜居的街区

sentences.english: T.S. Eliot’s highly influential poem, ‘The Waste Land’ T.S.
sentences.chinese: 艾略特极有影响力的诗作《荒原》

sentences.english: a highly developed economy
sentences.chinese: 高度发达的经济

detailed_translations.english: very

name: hike
trans: n. (在乡间)徒步旅行〈口〉(数量、价格等)增加, 上升
时态:hiked, hiking, hikes名 词:hiker

sentences.english: He wants to hike round the world.
sentences.chinese: 他打算徒步旅行环游世界一周。

sentences.english: You can organize a picnic in the park, a group hike or bike ride, or meet up with friends for one of those free local events.
sentences.chinese: 你可以组织在公园野餐一群徒步旅行或者骑自行车或者和朋友会面为其中的一个免费本地事件。

detailed_translations.english: to take a long walk in the mountains or countryside
a long walk in the mountains or countryside
to increase a price, tax etc by a large amount

name: hire
trans: n. 租用, 雇用租金, 工钱
时态:hired, hiring, hires名 词:hirer

sentences.english: The best way to explore the island is to hire a car.
sentences.chinese: 在该岛寻幽访胜的最好方式就是租用一辆汽车。

sentences.english: What does it cost to hire a boat for a week?
sentences.chinese: 一艘小船租用一星期的费用是多少？

sentences.english: a car hire company
sentences.chinese: 汽车租赁公司

detailed_translations.english: to pay money to borrow something for a short period of time
an arrangement in which you pay a sum of money to borrow something for a short time

name: commute
trans: vt. 交换；减刑；用……交换；使……变成

sentences.english: Baldry’s 20-year prison sentence was commuted to three years.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德里二十年的刑期被减至三年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘公交车上下班，经常乘车往返于两地
减； 折合， 折偿； 上下班交通
detailed_translations.english: to regularly travel a long distance to get to work

name: hold
trans: vt. 持有；保存；拥有；拘留；约束或控制

sentences.english: She was holding a large box.
sentences.chinese: 她提着一只大箱子。

sentences.english: I held the mouse by its tail.
sentences.chinese: 我抓着耗子的尾巴倒提起来。

sentences.english: Employees hold 30% of the shares.
sentences.chinese: 雇员持有30%的股份。

detailed_translations.english: to carry sth; to have sb/sth in your hand, arms, etc.

name: host
trans: n. 主人；主机；主持人；许多

sentences.english: Which country is going to host the next World Cup?
sentences.chinese: 哪个国家将主办下一届世界杯？

detailed_translations.english: to provide the place and everything that is needed for an organized event

sentences.english: I moved to this city six years ago.
sentences.chinese: 六年前我搬到了这个城市。

sentences.english: I’m not late again, am I?
sentences.chinese: 我没有又迟到吧？

sentences.english: My husband and I enjoy going to the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫喜欢去剧院看戏。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself

name: identification
trans: n. 鉴定, 验明, 认出身份证明认同

sentences.english: Do you have any identification?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么身份证明文件吗？

sentences.english: His body was taken to Brighton mortuary for identification.
sentences.chinese: 他的尸体被送到布赖顿停尸所确认身份。

name: identify
trans: vt. 认出，识别支持，同情
vt. & vi. 等同于；有关联

sentences.chinese: 他离得太远，没法看面孔认出谁是谁。

sentences.english: The police took fingerprints and identified the body.
sentences.chinese: 警方采集了指纹，对尸体作了身份确认。

detailed_translations.english: to recognize and correctly name someone or something

name: imaginative
trans: adj. 富于想像力的; 运用想像力的副 词:imaginatively

sentences.english: an imaginative use of computer technology
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术的妙用

sentences.english: children’s imaginative play
sentences.chinese: 儿童富有想象力的游戏

sentences.english: an imaginative solution to the litter problem
sentences.chinese: 解决乱扔垃圾的问题的有创意的方法

detailed_translations.english: containing new and interesting ideas

name: immediate
trans: adj. 立即的，即刻的；紧迫的目前的，当前的直接的最接近的名 词:immediateness

sentences.chinese: 我们对攻击的第一反应就是非常惊恐。

sentences.english: They promise immediate action to help the unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 他们承诺立即采取行动帮助失业者。

sentences.english: If the eyes are affected, seek immediate medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 如果眼睛感染了要立即就医。

sentences.english: The funeral was attended by her immediate family (= her parents, children, brothers and sisters) only.
sentences.chinese: 只有她的直系亲属参加了葬礼。

name: immediately
trans: v. 立即, 马上直接地

sentences.english: He retired immediately after the end of the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争一结束他就退休了。

sentences.english: Those most immediately involved in the disaster will be given support.
sentences.chinese: 灾害最直接受害者将获得援助。

detailed_translations.english: very soon before or after something

trans: adj. 不耐烦的, 急躁的热切的, 急切的副 词:impatiently

sentences.chinese: 我注意到一件事，就是当人们在等待的时候，人们会变的没有耐心、焦躁不安。

name: implement
trans: vt. 使生效, 贯彻, 执行
n. 工具, 器具, 用具
时态:implemented, implementing, implements名 词:implementation

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work

sentences.english: an implied threat
sentences.chinese: 隐含的威胁

sentences.chinese: 这些岩石内的高辐射水平显示它们是由火山作用形成的。

name: improper
trans: adj. 不合适的, 不适当的不正派的, 下流的副 词:improperly

sentences.english: 25 officers were investigated following allegations of improper conduct.
sentences.chinese: 25名警官被指控行为不当而受到调查。

detailed_translations.english: dishonest, illegal, or morally wrong

name: improve
trans: vt. 改善，增进；提高…的价值

sentences.english: a course for students wishing to improve their English
sentences.chinese: 为想提高英语水平的学生开设的一门课

sentences.english: The doctors say she is improving (= after being ill ).
sentences.chinese: 医生说她正在康复。

sentences.english: You could use the money for improving your home.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用这笔钱改善家居。

sentences.english: Many wines improve with age (= get better as they get older ).
sentences.chinese: 很多葡萄酒年代越久越香醇。

detailed_translations.english: to make something better, or to become better
to make something better, or to become better

name: improvement
trans: n. 增加或修改改进, 改善, 改良

sentences.english: Our results have shown some improvement this month.
sentences.chinese: 我们的成绩这个月有所提高。

sentences.english: Are you making some improvements to your home?
sentences.chinese: 你在改善家里的居住条件吗？

detailed_translations.english: the act of improving something or the state of being improved

name: inclined
trans: adj. 倾向…的, 有…意向的易于…的, 有…趋势的

sentences.english: Commandos are inclined to shoot first and ask questions later.
sentences.chinese: 突击队员往往会先开枪，然后再问话。

sentences.english: He was inclined to self-pity.
sentences.chinese: 他爱自怜。

detailed_translations.english: to be likely to do something or behave in a particular way

sentences.english: Does the price include postage?
sentences.chinese: 这个价格包含邮费吗？

sentences.english: His job includes looking after under-21 teams.
sentences.chinese: 他的职责包括照管21岁以下球队。

sentences.english: The curriculum includes courses in computing.
sentences.chinese: 课程内容包括计算机技术。

detailed_translations.english: if one thing includes another, the second thing is part of the first

sentences.english: With the recent inclusions, there will be 28 delegates in all.
sentences.chinese: 连同新近加入的成员，总共将有28位代表。

detailed_translations.english: the act of including someone or something in a larger group or set, or the fact of being included in one

name: inconvenience
trans: n. 不方便, 麻烦, 打扰不便之处, 麻烦事
vt. 给…带来不便, 给…添麻烦, 打扰

sentences.english: We apologise for the delay and any inconvenience caused.
sentences.chinese: 我们对延误和由此造成的不便深感抱歉。

detailed_translations.english: problems caused by something which annoy or affect you
to cause problems for someone

name: increase
trans: vt. & vi. 增加, 增大, 增多
n. 增加, 增大, 增多

sentences.english: The population increased dramatically in the first half of the century.
sentences.chinese: 该世纪上半叶，人口大幅度增加。

sentences.english: political tensions that might increase the likelihood of war
sentences.chinese: 或许会增加战争爆发可能性的紧张政治局面

sentences.english: Visits to the site have increased threefold since May.
sentences.chinese: 来这里的参观者自5月起已增至原来的三倍。

sentences.english: an increase in spending
sentences.chinese: 开支的增长

detailed_translations.english: to become or to make sth greater in amount, number, value, etc.
a rise in the amount, number or value of sth

name: indicate
trans: vt. 标示，指示，指出象征；表明或暗示…的可能性

sentences.english: The study indicates a connection between poverty and crime.
sentences.chinese: 研究显示贫穷和犯罪有关联。

detailed_translations.english: to show that a particular situation exists, or that something is likely to be true

name: indication
trans: n. 指示, 表示象征, 迹象

sentences.english: Could you give me some indication as to when I am likely to receive a reply?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我透露一下什么时候我能收到回复吗？

sentences.english: Indications are that the situation hasn’t improved much.
sentences.chinese: 迹象表明局势并没有多大好转。

sentences.english: There is every indication (= there are very clear signs ) that it is true.
sentences.chinese: 很明显这是真的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指示， 表示， 表明； 象征， 迹象
detailed_translations.english: a sign, remark, event etc that shows what is happening, what someone is thinking or feeling, or what is true

name: individual
trans: adj. 个别的, 单独的, 个人的独特的

sentences.english: Each individual leaf on the tree is different.
sentences.chinese: 树上每片叶子都不相同。

sentences.english: the needs of the individual customer
sentences.chinese: 每位顾客的需求

detailed_translations.english: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

name: individually
trans: v. 分别地，各个地；各自地独特地，与众不同地

sentences.english: The bridegroom thanked them all individually.
sentences.chinese: 新郎向他们一一道谢。

sentences.english: individually wrapped portions of cheese
sentences.chinese: 独立包装的一份份干酪

detailed_translations.english: separately, not together in a group

name: inexperienced
trans: adj. 经验不足的,不熟练的

sentences.english: inexperienced pilots
sentences.chinese: 经验不足的飞行员

detailed_translations.english: not having had much experience

sentences.english: A lot can be inferred from these statistics.
sentences.chinese: 根据这些统计资料可以推断出很多事情。

sentences.english: From the evidence, we can infer that the victim knew her killer.
sentences.chinese: 根据证据我们可以推断出受害者认识凶手。

detailed_translations.english: to form an opinion that something is probably true because of information that you have

name: inflate
trans: vt. 使充气；使通货膨胀

sentences.english: It took us half an hour to inflate the dinghy.
sentences.chinese: 我们用了半小时给橡皮筏充好气。

sentences.english: Her life jacket failed to inflate.
sentences.chinese: 她的救生衣未能充进去气。

detailed_translations.english: to fill something with air or gas so it becomes larger, or to become filled with air or gas

name: influence
trans: n. 影响；感化力势力，权势产生影响的人[事物]

sentences.english: He used his influence to get his son into medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.english: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

detailed_translations.english: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

name: influential
trans: adj. 有影响的, 有权势的

sentences.english: He had influential friends.
sentences.chinese: 他有一些有影响力的朋友。

sentences.english: a highly influential art magazine
sentences.chinese: 一本极有影响力的艺术杂志

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of influence and therefore changing the way people think and behave

name: information
trans: n. 消息；资料；情报通知，告知形容词:informational

sentences.english: I need more information.
sentences.chinese: 我需要更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc

sentences.english: I don’t know who sent the gift, but I’ll make some inquiries.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道礼物是谁送的，但我会打听一下。

sentences.english: The police have launched a murder inquiry.
sentences.chinese: 警方已开始对谋杀案展开调查

detailed_translations.english: a question you ask in order to get information

name: installation
trans: n. 安装，设置；就职装置，设备军事设施

sentences.english: the installation and maintenance of alarm systems
sentences.chinese: 警报系统的安装和维护

sentences.english: The whole computer installation was nearly new.
sentences.chinese: 整套电脑设备几乎是全新的。

sentences.english: nuclear installations
sentences.chinese: 核设施

detailed_translations.english: when someone fits a piece of equipment somewhere

name: insurance
trans: n. 保险保险业保险费保险措施, 安全保障

sentences.english: Your father took out insurance to cover the mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲购买了抵押借款保险。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them money, especially regularly, and they pay the costs if something bad happens, for example if you become ill or your car is damaged

sentences.english: Have you insured the contents of your home?
sentences.chinese: 你给家庭财产投保了吗？

sentences.english: facilities to insure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to buy insurance so that you will receive money if something bad happens to you, your family, your possessions etc

sentences.english: Oddly enough, that is precisely what I intend.
sentences.chinese: 说也奇怪， 那正是我的打算。

sentences.english: They intend to be an army of light against the onslaught of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 他们打算成为一支光明之师对抗黑暗军团的猛烈进攻。

name: intently
trans: v. 专心地,专注地热切地,热心地

sentences.english: As we walked alongside each other, she listened intently as I told her about you, about us, about the wonderful times we shared.
sentences.chinese: 我们肩并肩地走着,她专心地听着我讲述你,讲述我们,以及我们一起分享的那些美好时光。

name: intern
trans: 时态:interned, interning, interns名 词:internship

sentences.english: ...a medical intern.
sentences.chinese: …一位实习医生。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has nearly finished training as a doctor and is working in a hospital
to put someone in prison without charging them with a crime, for political reasons or during a war

name: internal
trans: adj. 国内的；内部的；内在的名 词:internality

sentences.english: We have no interest in interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们对干涉其他国家内政不感兴趣。

sentences.english: the threat to internal security
sentences.chinese: 对国内安全的威胁

sentences.english: internal markets
sentences.chinese: 国内市场

sentences.english: There’s to be an internal inquiry into the whole affair.
sentences.chinese: 对整个事件将进行内部调查。

detailed_translations.english: within a particular country

name: international
trans: adj. 国际的, 国际间进行的副 词:internationally

sentences.english: the response of the international community
sentences.chinese: 国际社会的反响

sentences.english: the UN and other international organizations
sentences.chinese: 联合国和其他国际组织

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving more than one nation

name: internship
trans: n. 〈美〉实习医师,实习医师期

sentences.english: ...an internship in surgery in New York.
sentences.chinese: …一个在纽约做外科实习的职位。

detailed_translations.english: a job that lasts for a short time, that someone, especially a student, does in order to gain experience

name: invaluable
trans: adj. 无法估计的, 非常宝贵的副 词:invaluably

sentences.english: The internet is an invaluable source of information.
sentences.chinese: 因特网是十分有价值的信息来源。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非常宝贵的， 极为贵重的， 无价的
detailed_translations.english: extremely useful

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大 · 格雷厄姆 · 贝尔于1876年发明了电话。

detailed_translations.english: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing

name: invention
trans: n. 发明；发明物；发明才能；虚构

sentences.english: The invention of the computer has revolutionized the business world.
sentences.chinese: 电脑的发明使商界发生了根本变化。

sentences.english: They subsequently admitted that the story was pure invention.
sentences.chinese: 他们后来承认他们说的纯属虚构。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明，创造；捏造， 假话
detailed_translations.english: the act of inventing something

name: invest
trans: vt. 投资；耗费；授予；覆盖；包围

sentences.english: I’ve got a few thousand dollars I’m looking to invest.
sentences.chinese: 我有几千美元想作投资。

sentences.english: It was very difficult to leave a home we had invested so much in.
sentences.chinese: 那个家我们投入得太多，要离开真的很难。

detailed_translations.english: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: investigation
trans: n. (正式的)调查，侦查科学研究；学术研究

sentences.english: The investigation continued for nearly three years.
sentences.chinese: 调查持续了近三年。

sentences.english: a criminal investigation
sentences.chinese: 刑事调查

sentences.english: A private detective was hired to conduct the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 雇了一名私人侦探进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: an official attempt to find out the truth about or the cause of something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

sentences.english: We plan to buy some property as an investment.
sentences.chinese: 我们打算买些房地产作为投资。

sentences.english: a huge investment of time and effort
sentences.chinese: 时间和精力的大量投入

detailed_translations.english: the use of money to get a profit or to make a business activity successful, or the money that is used

sentences.english: I’m afraid I wasn’t invited.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我没有受到邀请。

sentences.english: Successful candidates will be invited for interview next week.
sentences.chinese: 通过甄别的候选人将获邀于下周参加面试。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone to come to a party, wedding, meal etc

name: isolate
trans: vt. 使孤立；使绝缘；使隔离
时态:isolated, isolating, isolates名 词:isolator

sentences.english: The town was isolated by the floods.
sentences.chinese: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。

sentences.english: The US has sought to isolate Cuba both economically and politically.
sentences.chinese: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

detailed_translations.english: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

name: item
trans: n. 一项，一件，一条；项目

sentences.english: He opened the cardboard box and took out each item.
sentences.chinese: 他打开纸板箱把里面的物品一一拿出来。

sentences.english: The store is having a sale on furniture and household items.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店正在减价出售家具和家居用品。

sentences.english: luxury items such as exotic spices and perfumes
sentences.chinese: 异国香料和香水之类的奢侈品

sentences.english: The original 1965 bottle is now a collector’s item (= one of a set of objects people like to collect because they are interesting or valuable ).
sentences.chinese: 这瓶1965年生产的原装酒现在是收藏品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔尤指清单上、一群或一组事物中的〕一项，一件，一条
detailed_translations.english: a single thing, especially one thing in a list, group, or set of things

sentences.english: large-scale military offensives which could jeopardize the UN peace process
sentences.chinese: 可能会破坏联合国和平进程的大规模军事进攻

detailed_translations.english: to risk losing or spoiling something important

name: jobless
trans: adj. 失业的，无业的；（关于）失业者的

sentences.english: Many sacrificed their weekend to join the hunt for the missing girl.
sentences.chinese: 许多人牺牲周末时间，加入了寻找失踪女孩的行动。

sentences.english: the benefits of joining our pension scheme
sentences.chinese: 参加我们的退休金计划的好处

sentences.english: Church leaders have joined the campaign to end foxhunting.
sentences.chinese: 教会领袖参与了禁止猎狐的运动。

sentences.english: Join the two pieces of wood with strong glue.
sentences.chinese: 用强力胶水把两块木头黏合起来。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to take part in an activity that other people are involved in

name: joint
trans: n. 关节；接合处，接合点；接缝；（牛，羊等的腿）大块肉
adj. 联合的，合办的；共同的；连接的
vt. 连接，贴合；接合；使有接头

sentences.english: The two ministers have issued a joint statement.
sentences.chinese: 两位部长发布了一项联合声明。

sentences.english: Both companies are involved in the joint development of a new medium-sized car.
sentences.chinese: 两家公司联合开发一款新的中型汽车。

sentences.english: The meal was a joint effort(= two or more people worked on it together ).
sentences.chinese: 这顿饭是大家一起做的。

sentences.english: Manchester United and Arsenal are joint favourites to win the title (= are thought to have the same chance of winning ).
sentences.chinese: 曼联和阿森纳均为夺冠的热门球队。

sentences.english: Both parties must sign the form if the account is to be in joint names(= belong to two named people ).
sentences.chinese: 如果这是联名账户的话，双方都必须在表格上签名。

detailed_translations.english: involving two or more people or groups, or owned or shared by them
a part of your body that can bend because two bones meet there

name: journal
trans: n. 日报，杂志；日记；[经]分类账

sentences.english: the British Medical Journal
sentences.chinese: 《英国医学杂志》

sentences.english: He decided to keep a journal.
sentences.chinese: 他决定记日记。

detailed_translations.english: a serious magazine produced for professional people or those with a particular interest

sentences.english: the friends they made on the journey
sentences.chinese: 他们在旅途中交下的朋友

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when you travel from one place to another, especially over a long distance
an occasion when you travel from one place to another, especially over a long distance

name: judge
trans: n. 法官裁判员，评判员鉴定人，鉴赏家
vt. & vi. 审判；评判；断定

sentences.english: You should never judge a person by their looks.
sentences.chinese: 决不要以貌取人。

sentences.english: Judge us on the improvements we make in the economy.
sentences.chinese: 请根据我们在经济方面取得的进步来评价我们。

sentences.english: The therapist judged that Margaret had made a serious attempt to kill herself.
sentences.chinese: 治疗专家断定玛格丽特曾真的企图自杀。

sentences.english: pollutants that were judged hazardous to human health
sentences.chinese: 被认为对人体健康有害的污染物

sentences.english: I am in no position to judge whether what she is doing is right or wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我无权评判她在做的事是对是错。

sentences.english: The economic results of the reforms are very difficult to judge.
sentences.chinese: 这些改革所带来的经济成效很难评价。

sentences.english: The likelihood of future bombs was impossible to judge.
sentences.chinese: 未来发生爆炸案的可能性无法预测。

sentences.english: We judge the success of a product by the number of sales it brings in.
sentences.chinese: 我们以销量来评价一种产品成功与否。

sentences.english: His conduct, judged objectively by what he has done, is dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为，从他所做的这一切客观地来评价，是不诚实的。

sentences.english: Robert wanted to go and help him, but judged it best to stay where he was.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特想过去帮他，但考虑之后还是觉得待在原地为妙。

sentences.english: Do not judge her too harshly, as she was very young at the time.
sentences.chinese: 对她的评价不要太苛刻，毕竟那时候她还很年轻。

detailed_translations.english: to form or give an opinion about someone or something after thinking carefully about all the information you know about them
the official in control of a court, who decides how criminals should be punished

name: justice
trans: n. 正义；公正，合理法律制裁；司法；审判法官

sentences.english: Children have a strong sense of justice.
sentences.chinese: 儿童有很强的正义感。

sentences.english: His people came to him demanding justice.
sentences.chinese: 他的手下来找他，寻求公正。

detailed_translations.english: fairness in the way people are treated

name: justification
trans: n. 理由；辩护；认为有理，认为正当；释罪

sentences.english: Hoggart felt, with some justification, that his colleagues had let him down.
sentences.chinese: 霍加特觉得同事令他失望，这是有理由的。

detailed_translations.english: a good and acceptable reason for doing something

sentences.english: Ministers must appear before Parliament and justify their actions.
sentences.chinese: 大臣们必须就自己的行为向议会作出解释。

detailed_translations.english: to give an acceptable explanation for something that other people think is unreasonable

name: keen
trans: adj. 锋利的热衷的，热心的，渴望(做某事)激烈的，紧张的良好的；敏锐的，敏捷的比较级:keener，keenest副 词:keenly

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

name: keep
trans: vt. 保有，保存，保留阻止，防止，耽搁履行，遵守

sentences.english: The noise kept him awake.
sentences.chinese: 噪音使他一直醒着。

sentences.english: I was struggling to keep awake.
sentences.chinese: 我努力不让自己睡着。

detailed_translations.english: to stay in a particular state, condition, or position, or to make someone or something do this

sentences.english: I knocked and knocked but nobody answered.
sentences.chinese: 我把门敲了又敲，但无人回应。

sentences.english: He got a nasty knock on the head.
sentences.chinese: 他头部遭到重重一击。

detailed_translations.english: to hit a door or window with your closed hand to attract the attention of the people inside
a sharp blow from sth hard

name: know
trans: 时态:knew known knowing, knows形容词:knowable

sentences.english: Who knows the answer?
sentences.chinese: 谁知道答案？

sentences.english: There are instructions telling you everything you need to know.
sentences.chinese: 操作指南会告诉你所有须知事项。

sentences.english: Didn’t you know that?
sentences.chinese: 你不知道那件事吗？

sentences.english: I know all about David and what he’s been up to!
sentences.chinese: 我对戴维和他一直在干什么都知道得一清二楚！

sentences.english: Let me know (= tell me ) what time you’re planning to arrive.
sentences.chinese: 请告诉我你打算什么时候到。

sentences.english: I thought you’d want to know immediately.
sentences.chinese: 我以为你想马上知道。

sentences.english: If you must know, I was with James last night (= used when you are angry because someone wants to know something ).
sentences.chinese: 如果你非要知道的话，我昨晚是和詹姆斯在一起。

sentences.english: How did he know (= how did he find information about ) our names?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么知道我们姓名的？

detailed_translations.english: to have information about something

name: knowledge
trans: n. 了解, 理解个人的知识[学识, 见闻]学问

sentences.english: He did not have much knowledge of American history.
sentences.chinese: 他对美国历史所知不多。

sentences.english: Evans denied all knowledge of the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 埃文斯说他对这次抢劫一无所知。

detailed_translations.english: the information, skills, and understanding that you have gained through learning or experience

name: knowledgeable
trans: adj. 博学的;有见识的;知识渊博的副 词:knowledgeably

sentences.english: Do you think you are more knowledgeable about life than your parents were at your age?
sentences.chinese: 父母在你这个年龄时，你认为你比他们更了解生活吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 知识渊博的，有知识的；有见识的；聪明的
detailed_translations.english: knowing a lot

name: labor
trans: n. 劳工；分娩；劳动；工作
时态:labored, laboring, labors名 词:laborer

sentences.english: I should assign you your share of labor, and compel you to accomplish it.
sentences.chinese: 我要把属于你的那份劳动分配给你，并且强迫你完成它。

sentences.english: For the happiness of human labor, this is how magnificent cause, this goal is how great!
sentences.chinese: 为人类的幸福而劳动，这是多么壮丽的事业，这个目标有多么伟大！

sentences.english: However, after years of labor in their chosen field, they begin to hate their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他们在选择的领域工作了几年后，便开始痛恨自己的工作。

name: lack
trans: vt. 缺乏；没有；需要；不足

sentences.english: Alex’s real problem is that he lacks confidence.
sentences.chinese: 亚历克斯的真正问题是缺乏信心。

detailed_translations.english: to not have something that you need, or not have enough of it

name: law
trans: n. 法律；法学；诉讼；法治；司法界；规律
vt. 控告；对…起诉LAWabbr. Light Antitank Weapon 轻型反坦克武器

sentences.english: Elected officials ought to obey the law.
sentences.chinese: 民选官员理应遵守法律。

sentences.english: laws passed by Parliament
sentences.chinese: 议会通过的法律

detailed_translations.english: the whole system of rules that people in a particular country or area must obey

name: leak
trans: 时态:leaked, leaking, leaks名 词:leaker

sentences.english: The roof is leaking.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶在漏水。

sentences.english: A tanker is leaking oil off the coast of Scotland.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰海岸附近有一艘油轮漏油。

sentences.english: 英语例句：The boat had sprung a leak (= a hole had appeared in it ).
sentences.chinese: 小船出现了漏洞。

detailed_translations.english: if a container, pipe, roof etc leaks, or if it leaks gas, liquid etc, there is a small hole or crack in it that lets gas or liquid flow through
a small hole that lets liquid or gas flow into or out of something

name: lean
trans: vi. 倾斜；倚靠；倾向；依赖
adj. 瘦的；贫乏的，歉收的
时态:leaned, leaning, leans名 词:leanness

sentences.english: They were leaning forward, facing each other.
sentences.chinese: 他们面对面身体前倾。

sentences.english: He was leaning on the bridge, watching the boats go by.
sentences.chinese: 他靠在桥上，看着船来船往。

detailed_translations.english: to move or bend your body in a particular direction

name: lend
trans: 时态:lent lending, lends名 词:lender

sentences.english: The hospital agreed to lend us a wheelchair.
sentences.chinese: 医院同意借给我们一把轮椅。

sentences.english: The bank is reassessing its criteria for lending money.
sentences.chinese: 银行正在重新评估其贷款标准。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone borrow money or something that belongs to you for a short time

name: liability
trans: n. 责任，义务；倾向债务〈口〉妨碍，不利

sentences.english: Tenants have legal liability for any damage they cause.
sentences.chinese: 承租人造成任何损坏都要负法律责任。

sentences.english: The company had assets of $138 million and liabilities of $120.5 million.
sentences.chinese: 该公司有1.38亿美元资产和1.205亿美元的负债。

detailed_translations.english: legal responsibility for something, especially for paying money that is owed, or for damage or injury

name: license
trans: n. 执照，许可证；特许（同 licence）
v. 许可；特许；发许可证给

sentences.english: No special license will be regranted to anyone from now on.
sentences.chinese: 特殊许可证今后不得向任何人再行发放。

sentences.english: Remind me to renew the driver's license.It will lapse next month.
sentences.chinese: 提醒我更换驾驶执照，它下个月就失效了。

sentences.english: The next time the client connects to the server, it will obtain another license.
sentences.chinese: 在客户端下一次连接到服务器时，它将获得另一个许可证。

detailed_translations.english: to give official permission for someone to do or produce something, or for an activity to take place

name: lie
trans: vi. 躺, 卧位于展现, 伸展说谎
n. 谎话LIE液体离子蒸发

sentences.english: to lie on your back/side/front
sentences.chinese: 仰 / 侧 / 俯卧

sentences.english: The book lay open on his desk.
sentences.chinese: 那本书摊开放在他的书桌上。

sentences.english: The town lies in a small wooded valley.
sentences.chinese: 该城镇坐落于一个林木茂盛的山谷中。

detailed_translations.english: to be or put yourself in a flat or horizontal position so that you are not standing or sitting

sentences.english: My knowledge of the business is limited.
sentences.chinese: 我对这一行了解有限。

sentences.english: The organization has very limited resources.
sentences.chinese: 这家机构资源非常有限。

sentences.english: So far, the education reforms have had only limited success.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止，教育改革只取得了有限的成效。

detailed_translations.english: not very great in amount, number, ability etc

sentences.english: Supervisors in this unit group supervise and co-ordinate activities of truck drivers, bus drivers, delivery drivers, subway and other transit operators, chauffeurs and taxi and limousine drivers.
sentences.chinese: 本单元组主管监督和协调卡车司机，巴士司机，送货司机，地铁及其他交通营办商，司机，出租车和豪华轿车司机的活动。

sentences.english: In 1992, George Bush visited Australia and, from the window of his limousine, held up his index and middle fingers in the "V" shape, a la Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 1992年，乔治·布什拜访澳大利的时候，效仿温斯顿·丘吉尔，从豪华的轿车里伸出食指和中指作出“V”字形的手势。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大型轿车， 大型豪华轿车
detailed_translations.english: a very large, expensive, and comfortable car, driven by someone who is paid to drive

name: list
trans: n. 一览表, 目录, 名单, 清单
vt. 列出, 列入, 把…编列成表
时态:listed, listing, lists名 词:lister

sentences.english: Make a list of all the things you have to do.
sentences.chinese: 把你必须做的所有事情列一个清单。

sentences.english: The first person on my list is Mrs Gilling.
sentences.chinese: 我的名单上排在第一位的是吉林夫人。

sentences.english: The guidebook lists 1,000 hotels and restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 旅游手册上列有1,000家宾馆和餐厅。

detailed_translations.english: a set of names, numbers etc, usually written one below the other, for example so that you can remember or check them
to write a list, or mention things one after the other

name: patented
trans: patent (noun) patent (verb)patent4 ENTRIES FOUND:patent (adjective)patent (noun)patent (verb)patent leather (noun)1 patentadjective1 patentadjectiveLearner's definition of PATENTalways used before a noun1/ˈpætn̩t/ Brit /ˈpeɪtn̩t/ : of, relating to, or concerned with patents专利的a patent law/lawyer专利法/律师The company settled a patent dispute last year.公司去年解决了一起专利纠纷。the licensing of patent rights颁发专利权许可证a patent application专利申请They were sued for patent infringement.他们被起诉专利侵权。a patent holder/owner专利权人2/ˈpeɪtn̩t/ formal : obvious or clear明显的；清楚的His explanation turned out to be a patent lie.他的解释显然是在撒谎。She acted with patent disregard for the rules.她的举止明显表现出对规则的漠视。— patently adverbIt is patently obvious that she is overqualified for the job.很明显，对于这个工作岗位她的资历过高。2 patent/ˈpætn̩t/ Brit /ˈpeɪtn̩t/nounplural patents2 patent/ˈpætn̩t/ Brit /ˈpeɪtn̩t/nounplural patentsLearner's definition of PATENT: an official document that gives a person or company the right to be the only one that makes or sells a product for a certain period of time专利证书；专利；专利权[count] — often + onThe company holds the/a patent on the product.公司拥有这一产品的专利权。They want to take out a patent on [=obtain a patent for] the process.他们想获得此项工艺的专利。— often + forShe applied for patents for several of her inventions.她为她的几项发明申请了专利。[noncount]The product is protected by patent.这一产品受到专利保护。3 patent/ˈpætn̩t/ Brit /ˈpeɪtn̩t/verbpatents; patented; patenting3 patent/ˈpætn̩t/ Brit /ˈpeɪtn̩t/verbpatents; patented; patentingLearner's definition of PATENT[+ object]: to get a patent for (something)取得专利权They patented their inventio
n.他们为自己的发明拿到了专利权。The product was patented by its inventor.这一产品的发明者获得了专利。a patented process/drug已有专利权的工艺流程/药品

name: popular
trans: adj. 流行的，通俗的；受欢迎的；大众的；普及的副 词:popularly

sentences.english: Hilary was popular at school.
sentences.chinese: 希拉里在学校里很受欢迎。

sentences.english: a popular holiday resort
sentences.chinese: 人们喜欢的度假胜地

sentences.english: Coffee is probably the most popular drink in the world.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡很可能是世界上最受欢迎的饮料。

sentences.english: a popular movement for democracy
sentences.chinese: 争取民主的全民运动

detailed_translations.english: liked by a lot of people

name: popularity
trans: n. 普遍，流行；受欢迎；有声望

sentences.english: The president’s popularity has declined considerably.
sentences.chinese: 总统的支持率大大下降了。

detailed_translations.english: when something or someone is liked or supported by a lot of people

name: position
trans: n. 位置，方位；职位，工作；姿态；站位
vt. 安置；把……放在适当位置

sentences.english: Lie in a comfortable position .
sentences.chinese: 以一个舒服的姿势躺下。

sentences.english: Our hotel was in a superb central position near St Mark’s Square.
sentences.chinese: 我们的酒店处于极佳的中心位置，在圣马克广场附近。

sentences.english: Bruce is thinking of applying for the position.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯正在考虑申请那个职位。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone is standing, sitting, or lying

name: postponement
trans: n. 延期, 推迟延期的事

name: power
trans: n. 能力；力量；功率；幂；势力；政权
vt. 激励；供以动力；使…有力量
adj. 借影响有权势人物以操纵权力的

sentences.english: It is not within my power (= I am unable or not in a position) to help you.
sentences.chinese: 我是爱莫能助啊。

sentences.english: The ship was helpless against the power of the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船只能任凭强大的暴风雨肆虐。

sentences.english: The Secretary of State has the power to approve the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 国务卿有权批准这些提议。

sentences.english: 4 to the power of 3 is 4^3 (= 4 × 4 × 4 = 64).
sentences.chinese: 4的3次方是4^3。

detailed_translations.english: the ability or right to control people or events

name: practical
trans: adj. 实际的，实践的实用的注重实际的；有实际工作能力的名 词:practicality

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: practically
trans: v. 几乎；简直实际地，实事求是地

sentences.english: I’ve read practically all of his books.
sentences.chinese: 我差不多读过他所有的书。

sentences.english: She sees him practically every day.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎天天见到他。

sentences.english: It’s practically impossible to predict what will happen.
sentences.chinese: 将会发生什么，几乎不能预料。

sentences.english: The two designs were practically identical.
sentences.chinese: 这两个设计几乎一模一样。

detailed_translations.english: almost

name: predict
trans: vi. 作出预言；作预料，作预报
时态:predicted, predicting, predicts名 词:predictability

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

name: predictable
trans: adj. 可预言〔预报〕的不出所料的，可以想见的；平庸的；墨守成规的；毫无想像力的

sentences.english: The snow had a predictable effect on traffic.
sentences.chinese: 这场雪对交通造成的影响可以预见。

sentences.english: an entertaining but predictable film
sentences.chinese: 一部有趣但老套的电影

sentences.english: Logan’s reaction was predictable.
sentences.chinese: 洛根的反应可想而知。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone is predictable, you know what will happen or what they will do – sometimes used to show disapproval

name: prefer
trans: vt. 宁愿；更喜欢；提出；提升

sentences.english: She prefers her coffee black.
sentences.chinese: 她更喜欢喝黑咖啡。

detailed_translations.english: to like someone or something more than someone or something else, so that you would choose it if you could

name: preference
trans: n. 较喜欢的东西, 偏爱优待, 优惠, 优先权

sentences.english: Do you have a colour preference ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

sentences.english: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
sentences.chinese: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。

sentences.english: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
sentences.chinese: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。

sentences.english: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

sentences.english: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

name: premises
trans: n. (包括附属建筑、土地等在内的)房屋或其他建筑物(契约)前言，契据的缘起部分(记述财产的详情、当事人姓名等)

name: prepare
trans: vt. & vi. 筹备, 进行各项准备工作做好思想准备
时态:prepared, preparing, prepares 缩 写:prep

sentences.english: The prosecution wanted more time to prepare their case.
sentences.chinese: 原告想要有更多的时间来准备诉讼。

detailed_translations.english: to make plans or arrangements for something that will happen in the future

name: present
trans: vt. 呈现；介绍；提出；赠送
时态:presented, presenting, presents名 词:presenter

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

name: presentation
trans: n. 提供, 显示外观授予(物), 赠送(仪式)报告表演形容词:presentational

sentences.english: the presentation ceremony
sentences.chinese: 颁奖仪式

sentences.english: Dr Evans thanked him for coming to make the presentations .
sentences.chinese: 埃文斯博士感谢他来颁奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提供， 显示； 外观， 图像； 授予， 赠送； 报告， 介绍； 表演
detailed_translations.english: the act of giving someone a prize or present at a formal ceremony

name: press
trans: n. 压；按；挤印刷机出版社；通讯社报刊，报界，新闻界
vi. 紧迫PRESSabbr. Pacific Range Electro-magnetic Signature Studies 太平洋区域电磁特征研究

sentences.english: Oxford University Press
sentences.chinese: 牛津大学出版社

sentences.english: We were able to watch the books rolling off the presses.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以看到书本从印刷机上源源不断地印出。

detailed_translations.english: a business that prints and publishes books

name: prevent
trans: 时态:prevented, preventing, prevents名 词:preventer

sentences.english: The rules are intended to prevent accidents.
sentences.chinese: 这些规定旨在预防事故。

sentences.english: We were prevented from entering the site.
sentences.chinese: 我们被阻止进入现场。

sentences.english: Wrap small ornaments in paper to prevent them being damaged.
sentences.chinese: 把小饰品用纸包上以免损坏。

detailed_translations.english: to stop something from happening, or stop someone from doing something

sentences.english: a fire prevention officer
sentences.chinese: 消防官员

sentences.english: You know what they say, prevention is better than cure (= it is better to stop something bad from happening than to remove the problem once it has happened ) .
sentences.chinese: 正所谓预防胜于治疗。

detailed_translations.english: when something bad is stopped from happening

name: price
trans: 时态:priced, pricing, prices名 词:pricer

sentences.english: The price of fuel keeps going up.
sentences.chinese: 燃料价格持续上涨。

sentences.english: They may pay a high price for their few years of glory.
sentences.chinese: 为了短短几年的辉煌，他们也许要付出高昂的代价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money you have to pay for something

name: priceless
trans: adj. 无价的, 贵重的, 无法估价的极荒唐而有趣的

sentences.english: priceless antiques
sentences.chinese: 极其贵重的古董

detailed_translations.chinese: 无价的；极贵重的；非常有趣的
detailed_translations.english: extremely valuable

name: principal
trans: n. 负责人，校长资本，本金被代理人，委托人副 词:principally

sentences.english: His principal reason for making the journey was to visit his family.
sentences.chinese: 他那次旅程的首要目的是探访家人。

sentences.english: Teaching is her principal source of income.
sentences.chinese: 教书是她主要的收入来源。

sentences.english: the principal character in the book
sentences.chinese: 书里的主人公

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 负责人， 校长； 资本， 本金； 主要演员， 主角
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of a school

name: principle
trans: n. 原则, 原理准则, 规范操守, 道义工作原理

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

name: private
trans: adj. 私人的；私有的；私下的
n. 列兵；二等兵副 词:privately

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

name: probability
trans: n. 可能性, 可能发生的事〈数〉概率

sentences.english: You must decide whether, on the balance of probabilities , he committed the crime.
sentences.chinese: 你们一定要权衡正反两方面的可能性，然后再裁定他是否犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: how likely something is, sometimes calculated in a mathematical way

name: probably
trans: v. 大概; 或许; 可能

sentences.english: It'll probably be OK.
sentences.chinese: 这大概没有问题。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that sth is likely to happen or to be true

name: process
trans: n. 过程，进行；方法，步骤；作用；程序；推移
adj. 经过特殊加工（或处理）的

sentences.english: the Israeli-Egyptian peace process
sentences.chinese: 以－埃和平进程

sentences.english: Recycling is an industrial process.
sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过程，进程；；工序；工艺流程
detailed_translations.english: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result
to deal with an official document, request etc in the usual way

name: profession
trans: n. 职业, 自由职业同业, 同行

sentences.english: people who work in the professions
sentences.chinese: 从事专业性工作的人

sentences.english: nurses, social workers, and other people in the caring professions
sentences.chinese: 护士、社工和其他从事护理行业的人

detailed_translations.english: a job that needs a high level of education and training

name: professional
trans: adj. 职业的, 专业的内行的, 有经验的有意的, 故意的
n. 具有某专业资格的人, 专业人士内行, 专家专门职业者, 职业选手副 词:professionally

sentences.english: What professional qualifications does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他有哪些专业资格？

sentences.english: You may need to seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。

sentences.english: the terms that doctors and other health professionals use
sentences.chinese: 医师和其他保健专业人员使用的术语

detailed_translations.english: relating to a job that needs special education and training
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or architect

name: profitability
trans: n. 获利(状况)，盈利(情况)

sentences.english: a decline in company profitability
sentences.chinese: 公司利润的下降

name: profitable
trans: adj. 有利可图的; 有益的副 词:profitably

sentences.english: The advertising campaign proved very profitable.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明，这次广告宣传活动卓有成效。

sentences.english: a highly profitable business
sentences.chinese: 盈利高的企业

sentences.english: a profitable afternoon
sentences.chinese: 有收获的下午

detailed_translations.english: producing a profit or a useful result

sentences.english: The police are disappointed by the slow pro-gress of the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 警方对调查进度缓慢感到失望。

sentences.english: We made good progress despite the snow.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下雪，我们的行程还是很顺利。

sentences.english: I asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
sentences.chinese: 我询问护士我儿子身体恢复得如何。

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something
to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stage

name: progressive
trans: adj. 不断前进的, 有进展的, 逐渐上升的进步的, 先进的副 词:progressively

sentences.english: a progressive administration
sentences.chinese: 进步的政府

sentences.english: progressive and forward-looking policies
sentences.chinese: 有前瞻性的进步政策

sentences.english: The Republicans were deeply split between progressives and conservatives.
sentences.chinese: 共和党进步派和保守派之间分歧很大。

detailed_translations.english: supporting new or modern ideas and methods, especially in politics and education
A progressive is someone who is progressive

name: project
trans: vt. & vi. 伸出，突出；表达特点
n. 项目，计划，方案，课题

sentences.english: The project aims to provide an analysis of children’s emotions.
sentences.chinese: 该计划旨在对儿童情绪作出分析。

sentences.english: a three-year research project
sentences.chinese: 一项为期三年的研究计划

sentences.english: The scheme will now be extended after a successful pilot project (= a small trial to test if an idea will be successful ) .
sentences.chinese: 试行成功后，该方案现在将得到推广。

sentences.english: The project is funded by Wellcome plc.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目由威康公司资助。

sentences.english: a project manager
sentences.chinese: 项目经理

sentences.english: a geography project
sentences.chinese: 一个地理课题

detailed_translations.english: a carefully planned piece of work to get information about something, to build something, to improve something etc

name: promotion
trans: n. 提升，晋级宣传；推销形容词:promotional

sentences.english: a society for the promotion of religious tolerance
sentences.chinese: 一个促进宗教包容的团体

sentences.english: I want a job with good prospects for promotion.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一份有良好晋升机会的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of helping something to develop or increase

name: promptly
trans: v. 敏捷地；迅速地；立即地准时地，正好

sentences.english: A reply came very promptly.
sentences.chinese: 马上就有了答复。

detailed_translations.english: without delay

name: properly
trans: v. 适当地；正确地；恰当地

sentences.english: The brakes don’t seem to be working properly.
sentences.chinese: 刹车似乎不正常。

sentences.english: Then he’s not doing his job properly.
sentences.chinese: 那么他没把分内事做好。

sentences.english: Parents should teach their children to behave properly in public.
sentences.chinese: 家长应该教导子女在公共场合要有规有矩。

sentences.english: properly trained staff
sentences.chinese: 训练有素的员工

detailed_translations.english: correctly, or in a way that is considered right

name: protect
trans: 时态:protected, protecting, protects副 词:protectingly

sentences.english: Are we doing enough to protect the environment?
sentences.chinese: 我们在保护环境方面做得够吗？

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness

name: protection
trans: n. 保护, 保卫贸易保护措施防护物(向歹徒缴纳的)保护费

sentences.english: the protection of the environment
sentences.chinese: 环境保护

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is protected

name: publicize
trans: vt. 宣传(某事物)(尤指用广告)

sentences.english: television’s failure to publicize the unemployment issue
sentences.chinese: 电视未能报道失业问题

detailed_translations.english: to give information about something to the public, so that they know about it

name: purpose
trans: n. 目的；意图作用；用途；效果意志；毅力；决心

sentences.english: The purpose of this meeting is to elect a new chairman.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议的目的是选出一位新主席。

detailed_translations.english: the purpose of something is what it is intended to achieve

name: pursue
trans: vt. 从事；追赶；继续；纠缠

sentences.english: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
sentences.chinese: 她计划从政。

sentences.english: Students should pursue their own interests , as well as do their school work.
sentences.chinese: 除了完成课业之外，学生也应该追求自己的兴趣。

sentences.english: a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor
sentences.chinese: 贯彻扶贫政策的竞选承诺

detailed_translations.english: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

name: qualification
trans: n. 合格证书资格, 条件限制, 限定性条件

sentences.english: He left school without any qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他离校时没有拿到任何文凭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a qualification, you have passed an examination or course to show you have a particular level of skill or knowledge in a subject

name: qualified
trans: adj. 有资格的，适合的，胜任的有限制的；不完全的

sentences.english: You are one of us, and you are qualified to be a member of this Republic.
sentences.chinese: 你是我们中的一员，你有资格成为这个共和国中的一份子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 限制（qualify的过去分词）；描述；授权予

name: qualify
trans: vt. & vi. (使)具有资格, (使)合格

sentences.english: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
sentences.chinese: 符合条件的儿童可获得免费的学生午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

sentences.english: Teachers will be asked to fill in a questionnaire.
sentences.chinese: 教师们将被要求填写一份调查问卷。

detailed_translations.english: a written set of questions which you give to a large number of people in order to collect information

name: quotation
trans: n. 引用, 引述引文, 引语, 语录时价, 报价, 行情

sentences.english: The following quotation is taken from a nineteenth century travel diary.
sentences.chinese: 下文引自19世纪的一篇旅行日记。

sentences.english: a dictionary of quotations
sentences.chinese: 引语词典，语录汇编

sentences.english: a quotation for car insurance
sentences.chinese: 汽车保险的报价单

detailed_translations.english: a sentence or phrase from a book, speech etc which you repeat in a speech or piece of writing because it is interesting or amusing

name: raise
trans: v. 提起；举起；竖起增加；提高；改善；引起，导致；使存在抚养；饲养；养育；喂养；种植（赌牌时）比对手多下赌注，提高（赌注），加赌注筹款解除；终止；解（禁）（尤指通过电话或无线电）与…取得联系，与…通话

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

name: range
trans: vi. 平行，列为一行；延伸；漫游；射程达到
vt. 使并列；归类于；漫游；来回走动；放牧

sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

vi. [方]用后腿站起；[美口]渴望比较级:rarer, rarest 缩 写:r

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.

n. 伸手可及的距离(江河的)河段

sentences.chinese: 我们深夜到达伦敦。

sentences.chinese: 她伸手从包里取出一张名片。

sentences.english: Chelsea could reach the final of the European Cup.

sentences.english: It was only later that I realized my mistake.

trans: vt. 重新安排, 重新布置改变既定的(计划等)做无用功，于事无补(就像重新摆放泰坦尼克号上的甲板躺椅一样)
时态:rearranged, rearranging, rearranges名 词:rearrangement

sentences.chinese: 她开始重新摆放起居室的家具。

detailed_translations.english: to change the position or order of things

trans: adj. 合乎情理的，可以接受的，适度的; 公平的，公道的名 词:reasonabilityor

sentences.chinese: 合情合理的要求

trans: v. 明辨道理地，合理地；有理性地相当地，适度地

sentences.chinese: 按理说，他是不可能知道那件事的。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is right or fair

trans: vt. & vi. 收到，接到接纳；接待

sentences.chinese: 每个孩子都会收到一份小礼物。

sentences.chinese: 李得到324票。

sentences.chinese: 欧文最新的书

sentences.english: It was malaria, but Dr Lee hadn’t recognized the symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 这是疟疾，但李医生没有认出症状。

sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: The recruitment of workers, soldiers, or members is the act or process of selecting them for an organization or army and persuading them to join

时态:reduced, reducing, reduces名 词:reducer

n. 减少；缩小；降低缩图；缩版

sentences.chinese: 减少噪音的对策

trans: adj. 因人员过剩而被解雇的不需要的; 多余的副 词:redundantly

sentences.chinese: 在继而发生的裁员中，70名工厂工人被解雇。

trans: v. 不顾后果地不管怎样, 无论如何副 词:regardlessly

sentences.chinese: 注册费是75美元。

sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

v. 经常地；定期地名 词:regularity

sentences.chinese: 人出汗以调节体温。

sentences.chinese: 和缓的运动可以使僵硬的肩部肌肉放松。

sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

vi. 留下，逗留剩下，余留留待

sentences.chinese: 难民获准留在英国。

sentences.english: They were cleaning up the remains of their picnic.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在打扫野餐的残余物。

name: remarkable
trans: adj. 异常的; 引人注目的; 不寻常的副 词:remarkably

sentences.english: She has made remarkable progress.
sentences.chinese: 她取得了显著的进步。

sentences.english: a remarkable coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的巧合

sentences.english: He’s a remarkable man .
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人。

name: reminder

sentences.chinese: 牙医寄来的检查提醒函

detailed_translations.english: something, for example a letter, that reminds you to do something which you might have forgotten

sentences.chinese: 请随信附上您的汇款，支票收款方为瓦利科技服务公司。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you send to pay for something

name: remove
trans: vt. 移开；拿开；去掉；除去；调动排除，去除，打消（负面情绪）将…免职；开除；解除（某人的职务）脱去（衣服等）；摘下
时态:removed, removing, removes名 词:remover

sentences.english: a cleaner that will remove wine stains
sentences.chinese: 可去除葡萄酒酒渍的清洁剂

sentences.english: The college removed rules that prevented women from enrolling.
sentences.chinese: 这所大学取消了禁止女性入学的规定。

detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer

sentences.chinese: 它通常还导致较低的翻新、清洁和保养维修费用。

sentences.english: For novice friends, we do not know how much the specific renovation costs?
sentences.chinese: 对于新手朋友来说，大家都不了解具体装修费用是多少？

sentences.english: I pay the rent at the beginning of every month.
sentences.chinese: 我每逢月初交付房租。

sentences.english: She rents out two rooms to students.
sentences.chinese: 她把两个房间出租给学生

detailed_translations.english: the money that someone pays regularly to use a room, house etc that belongs to someone else
to let someone live in a house, room etc that you own, or use your land, in return for money

name: repair
trans: vt. 恢复；修理；补救，纠正
n. 修理，修补；修补部位
时态:repaired, repairing, repairs名 词:repairability

sentences.english: Dad was up the ladder, repairing the roof.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸在梯子上修补屋顶。

sentences.english: Where can I get my shoes repaired ?
sentences.chinese: 哪儿能修补鞋子？

sentences.english: The church tower is in need of repair.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的塔楼需要修缮。

detailed_translations.english: to fix something that is damaged, broken, split, or not working properly

name: repayment
trans: n. 偿还;报答;偿付的钱物

sentences.english: monthly mortgage repayments of £330
sentences.chinese: 每月330英镑的按揭贷款还款额

detailed_translations.english: when you pay back money that you have borrowed

name: repetitive
trans: adj. 重复的, 啰嗦的名 词:repetitiveness

sentences.english: The song was dreary and repetitive.
sentences.chinese: 这首歌又枯燥又重复。

detailed_translations.english: done many times in the same way, and boring

name: replace

时态:replaced, replacing, replaces 缩 写:repl

sentences.english: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
sentences.chinese: 我将接替队里的休。

sentences.english: Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
sentences.chinese: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing

name: report

sentences.chinese: 我是加文·威廉斯，在纽约联合国总部为您报道。

sentences.chinese: 我们力求公正地报道这一新闻。
